reviews.title: King Tuts treasures
reviews.text: This is a very old museum filled with more than one can take in. The amount of funeral goods was amazing. The coffins were very colourful and worth seeing. The highlight of course is King Tuts gold mask and treasures from his tomb. Well worth the visit.

reviews.title: BREATH TAKING
reviews.text: so detailed and so amazing, I can't even explain. you have to be there to experience in person. took lots of photos and 1 day or two days is necessary to visit the whole museum. we had just a couple of hours.

reviews.title: very crowded, but really unique
reviews.text: when we arrived in Cairo Airport I couldn't believe how many other people were there. The next day, we visited the Museum and I think all of those people were in the museum with their friends! The museum itself is amazing. The King Tut exhibit is a famous one. But the crowds in there made it hard to enjoy very much. And watch out for the scam artists out front. Two guys (working in tandem?) told us in good English after our car dropped us off, that the museum was closed for 1/2 hour for prayers. One of the guys offered to take us to a nearby covered market. That turned out to be an ordinary souvenier shop. It didn't take too long and we got back to the museum...but just be careful.

reviews.title: Wow. Well worth a visit.
reviews.text: The Tutankhamen exhibit is jaw dropping. Many of the exhibits are. You really should go with a good guide. There are so many pieces they can guide you to the most interesting ones and give you the story that goes with them. The gift shop at the exit is also quite good.

reviews.title: Very good. Totally enjoy it
reviews.text: Our tour guide with headphones was very valuable as we could hear him over other people talking. Which allowed me to take photos while he spoke. Most of the displays have parts that is in transit to the new museum.

reviews.title: One of the World's Best Museums
reviews.text:
I first visited this museum 30 years ago.  It captivated me then and still captivates me.  The collection is so huge that I see something new each time I go.  There are periodic special exhibits using parts of the collection that are always interesting.  At some point the main crowd-pleasing parts of the collection like King Tut will move to the new museum, but it doesn't seem like that will happen before 2024 so there is still time to enjoy all the amazing things in one of the world's great museums.   

Take your time, don't be rushed, browse the side rooms and the dusty alcoves.

reviews.title: Blew my mind - what an incredible civilisation Egypt had/has !
reviews.text: This museum is well worth visiting - I walked from downtown (1.5 hours) as I wanted to do that, and I saw some really interesting neighbourhoods, but it is a cheap taxi ride from Tahrir Square. It is highly sophisticated in its curation, use of technology, and architecture, and the textiles in particular were fascinating to me. The mummified Pharoahs and high ranking individuals are displayed underground with great sensitivity and honour, and I was very moved by this. Finally, it's at the Cairo Lake, so sitting in the magnificent gardens is a must. Don't come to Cairo and miss this Museum, it is fabulous !

reviews.title: Amazing content, poorly organized
reviews.text: This is a must-visit, but it’s more like a catalogued warehouse than a museum. There is very limited historical context or background provided, and the rooms aren’t arranged in any particular order that we could tell. And with the transfer of many items to the new Grand Egyptian Museum at Giza, the collection is getting somewhat dispersed. The highlight is the Tutankhamen treasures room, which is truly spectacular — and very unique, since most other tombs had been robbed in antiquity. Go there first, especially if visiting at the end of the day. A lot of other very interesting sections, particularly the contents of tombs and some outstanding statues. Allow for two hours. If you can, go to the new Museum of Egyptian Civilization first, because it provides a better chronological explanation of Egyptian history.

reviews.title: Landmark museum
reviews.text: This is an absolute must see, at least for now.  Over the next months/years as they open the New Grand Egyptian Museum in Giza, perhaps this museum will become secondary, but for now, this is still a must d -- one of the most special museums in the world..

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text:
great experience seeing amazing collections,
this a great place to visit while in egypt.
the museum is very beautiful but you are not allowed to take photos

reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful experience
reviews.text: Visiting this museum is an incredibly beautiful experience. Located in the heart of Tahrir Square, Cairo, the Egyptian Museum is a unique building designed to host the world's oldest collection of Pharaonic art and monuments, including many must-see masterpieces like the gold mask of Tutankhamun. This golden mask is the most famous of all the artefacts of ancient Egypt, a true icon of the pharaonic civilization. The Mask of Tutankhamun is housed in a darkened room on the second floor amid the vast collection of treasures discovered in the tomb of the young king. There are no photos allowed (as the security regularly yells out) to protect the fragile death mask. The room also contains the spectacular inner coffin of Tutankhamun, along with jewelry and other objects found inside the tomb. The magnificent mask is decorated with semi-precious stones and inlaid with colored glass and gemstones. It is made with two layers of high-karat gold. The tomb of the young Pharaoh it is discovered by Howard Carter in 1925 in the Valley of the Kings in Luxor. Also worth seeing is the Narmer Palette, known as the first historical document in the world – and it depicts the unification of Upper and Lower Egypt in stunning detail. It is also must see in the multitude of artifacts the Statue of Pharaoh Djoser, statue of Pharaoh Menkaure Triad, statue of Pharaoh Khafre, Meidum Geese - known as "Egypt's Mona Lisa," this bold-colored painting depicts an extinct species of goose that lived 4,600 years ago in Ancient Egypt. Then, in room no. 32 on the ground floor, the Statue of Rahotep and Nofret is worth seeing. This realistic life-size statue depicts Prince Rahotep seated alongside his wife Nofret in beautifully expressive detail. Then everyone's favorite, Statuette of Khufu. This tiny ivory statuette is the only intact portrait of King Khufu, builder of the Great Pyramid of Giza. My favorite artifact is the Sphinx of Hatshepsut. As a sphinx, Hatshepsut displays a lion's mane and a king's beard. Hatshepsut ruled as a man, not as a woman, and for this reason her royal protocols and titles are always written without the feminine qualification, which is the "T" letter in the hieroglyphic. This is the case in the text inscribed on the base of this sphinx where it is written, "Beloved of the god Amun, endowed with life forever."

reviews.title: Excellent museum
reviews.text: This is a fantastic museum, with all the famous mummies and other great pieces.  The mummies were fascinating to see, some with hair that looked like it was done yesterday!  There were over 20 mummies and it was interesting to see the variety and they are all famous, so it’s more meaningful as you travel south on your trip and see their temples. The upper floor also has interesting pieces including the corpse of a body from 35000 years ago! Definitely worth going to, in addition to the Egyptian Museum.  We did not feel a guide was necessary for this museum - there were signs everywhere for knowledge and the time to spend taking in all the pieces is what made it special.  We felt a guide would take that experience away.  Have fun!

reviews.title: Definitely worth the Visit!!
reviews.text:
We highly recommend seeing it even though the Grand Egyptian Museum is not open yet.  And we recommend you use a Guide to cover the Egyptian Museum and the Civilization Museum (where all the big-name mummies are located).  You can cover both museums in 1 day.

Pink Lotus Tours, Cairo, provide AMAZING guides.

reviews.title: Priceless antiquities that deserve a better home
reviews.text:
Museum has the best collection of Egyptian antiquities in Egypt but sadly is very old and in need of maintenance. Sarcophagus, statues, figures were housed in wooden glass frames, some cracked leading one to wonder whether exposure to air would destroy these priceless works of art. There are huge stone Pharoahs, mummies, famous King Tut pieces in gold and many countless artifacts. A definite must see.

The good news is that a massive new museum to house these works is near completion. 

The pieces in this museum are stunning but deserving of a better home .

reviews.title: A great museum with English comments.
reviews.text: Best part was no Tipping in the restroom after all the fantastic exhibition.  KING TUTS exhibition is upstairs. I never thought I would see so much Egyptian history and artifacts. It made understanding the culture so much easier. It's a lovely 19th century building of marble. I went back for a second day. I may go a third time before leaving Egypt.

reviews.title: Great antiquities to see!
reviews.text: Great things to see in this building - King Tut's stuff being top of the list. The museum is really old and not well maintained - which is too bad. There were a lot if things that were hard to read/see because of the fact that the lights are burned out and need to be replaced. Still worth the visit. We went twice while in Cairo. Only costs foreigners about $8 and you can't beat that!

reviews.title: A wealth of history in one place
reviews.text: This museum is a must see when in Cairo.  The history of ancient Egypt is overwhelming and there's so much to see.

reviews.title: Lots to see in Cairo
reviews.text: Cairo has frightening traffic, so get a taxi. Negotiate the price before you get into it. The Old Egyptian museum is still open and has the most famous relics in it such as the gold mask of Tutankhamun (as of 26/02/2023). It will be moved to the new Grand Egyptian Museum just before it opens probably sometime this year but no definite date has been announced yet. The Museum of Egyptian Civilisation can most conveniently be visited on the way back to the hotels on the Nile Corniche, and is well worth it. The preserved heads of the most famous kings protrude above the wrappings around the rest of their bodies so you can look into the eyes of Ramases and other kings. There is a walkway right along the banks of the Nile along the Corniche, but crossing the road from the hotels id daunting. No Zebra crossings or bridges. The Pyramids are just outside the town of Giza which has interesting Papyrus museums. There is little to see inside them - just steep narrow passages. Walking (or riding on camels) round them is well worthwhile as is a visit to the Sphinx. There are many other museums in Cairo which also look interesting.

reviews.title: Amazing glimpse into ancient Egypt
reviews.text: This was an incredible experience and opportunity to see some of the world's most interesting artifacts from the times of the Pharaohs and onwards. Compared to more modern museums of the West, visitors feel less detached from the artifacts on display, often separated by nothing at all or only the most minimal of protection.  It's clearly a working museum as it was quite easy to see many artifacts still being evaluated and/or not fully displayed yet throughout the halls.  This is a must stop for anyone traveling to Cairo, especially while the newer museums are still not quite ready for visitors.  Even then, this will be worth the stopover as it's centrally located and has many incredible holdings such as the Narmer Palette and Tutankhamun Hall.

reviews.title: Amazing but you really need days
reviews.text:
It is a huge place with lots of wonderful objects but many have already been transfered to the new Grand Egyptian Museum that may open by the end of the year.
The descriptions are offen missing and you really need a guide to get the most of your time. We had a very good one, Mohamed abd elatif (cairenegate@hotmail.com) The restaurant outside leaves a lot to be desired but we had fish and chips which turned out to be a fish-burito and quite tasty. The Museum store has a decent selection of useful books. Make sure to save your ticket if you want to go back to the museum...

reviews.title: Its huge
reviews.text: This place is huge. We spent like 2 hours there and i had a feeling that we didn't see like 1/3. Many cool and interesting things to see. Best thing is Tutankahumns mask, but unfortunately you are not allowed to take photos of it.

reviews.title: Wow
reviews.text: Amazing, just as you would expect, king tuts treasures, dusty hidden corners takes the breath away, stuff of dreams

reviews.title: Can't begin to see it all
reviews.text: Worthwhile. Our guide zipped us thru some highlights in 1.5 hours, but there was so much more. Egypt has SO many antiquities, of course they will soon open yet another museum.

reviews.title: Basically Amazing
reviews.text:
I'd consider this a "must see" when spending time in Cairo. The ancient artifacts are fantastic and there is a lot to explore and appreciate here. It's best done with a guide though. Don't expect it to be like the the Smithsonian or some place like that, where you can wander endlessly on your own and pick up most of it. 

The displays need work, some of the glass cases are old and discolored, and overall the museum feels disorganized  and beaten up a bit. The descriptions are often lacking, hence the need for a guide so you can fully appreciate what exactly you are looking at. I think they are in the process of building a new museum, which might explain the condition of this one. Still, my recommendation is simply, don't miss this!

reviews.title: Its all still there!
reviews.text: Really worried about the main treasures being there as stuff is being moved towards the new museum. However it is and its a great experience. I love the old feel of the place, some people dislike it but it has a special quality.

reviews.title: Just spectacular
reviews.text: Its just mind blowing to see the beauty of this place, a surreal and a its feels as if time stands still and to just be lost in the moment.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: Make sure you have at least one full day here. We were on a tour and only got a couple of hours. One day is the least you need to do this museum any justice.

reviews.title: Wonderful place to explore
reviews.text: The Museum of Egyptian Antiquities is interesting and so big but worth planning and exploring each part. Definitely worth the money.

reviews.title: A Great Time!
reviews.text: Hamdy (our guide) at the museum was awesome! He was nice, knowledgeable and funny. The welcome juice was soooo good! My girls and I had a great time!

reviews.title: A little messy but worth
reviews.text: As my title says don't expect a high level or organization lol. I felt like I was at my granny's house. Many artefacts didn't have labels so if you're not a geek in egyptian history you may not even notice you're standing in front of something very important. Other than that it was fun and indeed an exciting experience.

reviews.title: Egyptian masterpiece in one place
reviews.text:
Housed a lot of Egyptian antiquities. Worth the price of 200 LE which includes the Tutankhamun Treasures (not allowed to take photos) and the Mummy Hall (a huge collection of Sarcophagus without mummies inside).

Avoid going on weekends as it can get really crowded with all the tour groups that keep coming in. I went on a weekend and find it so difficult to move around, and take photos. Reading the description of each antiquity has to be fast as everyone is waiting to snap a picture.

reviews.title: Excellent place to explore
reviews.text: Wonderful museum, full of amazing and special statues, and artefacts, just brilliant. The staff were helpful, and well laid out. The cafe inside was good. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: A feast for your eyes!
reviews.text:
Simply incredible.
Plan to spend at least 2 hours here to see all the antiquities you can imagine. The curation is spectacular. You can take photographs and video in almost every area, but some rooms are off limits for archival reasons.
An unforgettable way to spend a day in amazing Cairo.

reviews.title: A must visit
reviews.text: We visited twice as a bit rushed the first time. A dusty and old museum, liked the character of it, lots to see.

reviews.title: Visited with Seba Tours
reviews.text: Zena  with Seba Tours did an excellent job getting us started on this historic tour! It was fun to see this museum and then visit all the sites.

reviews.title: Worthwhile Museum
reviews.text: This is the museum which currently holds Tutankamen’s gold mask and other objects found by Howard Carter. There are other exhibits arranged in chronological order. There is a reasonably priced gift shop and a pleasant outdoor coffee shop.

reviews.title: Ever surprising
reviews.text: Each time I walk through those doors and am greeted with majestic statuary, stunning jewelry creations and thousands more artistic gems, the genius of this ancient civilization once again awesome and inspires. Each time.

reviews.title: I got amazed !
reviews.text: I was just taken to charming Egyptian old Pharaohs inspirational atmosphere especially after we had experience to go to old Egyptian kings mummies hall ! I recommend my friends in Belarusian to come with me there in next vacations !

reviews.title: Don't miss!
reviews.text:
We went on Day 1 for 1.5 hours and needed to return the next day to complete the museum (another 3 hours).

There are so many things to see - it was amazing. It's a little disappointing that not all of the artifacts were labeled or had no information. The place is literally filled to the rafters with antiquities.

Seeing King Tut was definitely a check mark on the lifetime bucket list.

reviews.title: Busy but worth it
reviews.text: Absolutely worth a visit.  So much too see.  We went with our private guide and we were happy we did.  There is so much to see, it was a good idea to go with someone who could show you the highlights.

reviews.title: Living its emptiness
reviews.text:
Our visit in this Museum was full of sentiments, although some of them negative.
The place tends to be abandonded, let us see what happens when the new Museum in Giza is going to open.

reviews.title: Too many treasure
reviews.text: The tut ankh Amon stuff were amazing.. we also enjoyed the royal mummies chamber. my kid was a little bit afraid but we loved it so much

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: So many artifacts to study. Plan on a good half day for your visit at least. There are 2 floors and the King Tut Exhibit.

reviews.title: Overcrowded with a bit rude people
reviews.text: Second visit after some 15 years, it looks like the gorgeous pieces would deserve more care. No doubt the exposition is fenomenal. However, it is massively overcrowded with many people who absolutely don´t care of others, pushing, skipping the lines, blocking the corridors, shouting - this is no good.

reviews.title: Tick of bucket list.
reviews.text:
It was a real experience it was rather busy in some areas. However it was enjoyable and now ticked of my bucket list.
I wish there were places to rest as l am disabled and found it a bit overwhelming.

reviews.title: The museum was incredibly busy
reviews.text:
I've given the museum an average rating as, despite having a peerless collection of priceless Egyptian antiquities, there are serious downsides. Firstly the museum is so incredibly busy, I know that I was simply adding to the crowd but wow, there's just so many people crammed in here, and expect to get jostled by the larger groups. There's an additional queue to see Tutankhamun's mask that might make your heart sink a little bit when you see it.

On the museum's display side it's quite hard to understand the logic of how everything is laid out. It's almost as if with so much to curate the museum has just found space for things wherever it can. Also a lot of the collection is simply unlabelled, and the labels that do exist look very old.

My honest advice is to decide what you really want to see in advance, and then grit your teeth, brave the crowds, and find  those things with a laser like focus.

Hopefully things will be much much better when the new Grand Egyptian Museum opens, and this grand old lady can slip into a well earned retirement.

reviews.title: Amazing King Tut artifacts
reviews.text:
This is the museum that houses the Tutankhamun exhibits. we went in December in the afternoon. it was packed with people. 

You are not allowed to take any photos in the Tutankhamun gallery but the exhibits there were some of my most favourite things in our trip to Egypt.

The ticket cost EGP240. We covered the most in 2 hours, but you can easily spend 4 -5 hours going through everything. If you have time in Cairo, I highly recommend going to this Musaeum.

reviews.title: I had high expectations
reviews.text:
I had high expectations but was a little disappointed with this.  The layout appears to disjointed, the presentation of the pieces is not good, not well lit, not that well maintained. 
I am hoping that the new museum in Giza will open soon.  It is so much bigger than the current one.

reviews.title: Amazing, but wish the new museum was open!
reviews.text: So glad we had a guide in the museum. We were able to focus and learn rather than just March through. It will be wonderful when the new museum opens near the pyramids!

reviews.title: TUT
reviews.text: What makes this museum excellent is for sure the Tut exhibition.  Honestly, every thing else is kind of shabby looking but you go for the Tut exhibition.

location.address: Midan El Tahrir Geographical Society Building, Cairo 11511 Egypt

name: Al-Azhar Park
ranking_subcategory: #12 of 288 things to do in Cairo
subcategory_ranking: #12 of 288 things to do in Cairo
ranking: #12 of 288 things to do in Cairo

offer_list.title: Dream of the nile
Awesome Night with Dinner in El azhar Park in Cairo
Giza Pyramids
El Moez Street and Al Azhar Park Day Tour in Cairo
6-Hour Private Tour to the Alabaster Mosque City of Dead and Alazhar Park in Cairo

reviews.title: Urban oasis!
reviews.text: Must experience this. I can see hints of the Generalife in the design of the park and gardens.  Dinner at the Citadel View Restaurant was like being in a dream!  Save your pounds and splurge here.  You won't regret it.  Also, nice gift shop located off the lobby.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
reviews.text: Considering the area, this park was a welcomed retreat from the Hustle and bustle of Cairo. Surprisingly large and well planted. The air is fresh and it's quiet considering you're in Central Cairo.

reviews.title: Beauty and tranquility
reviews.text: Beauty and tranquility in the middle of Cairo.  Along with the pyramids, this park cannot be missed.  H H The Aga Khan has bequeathed AL Azhar to the City his ancestors founded.  Proceeds from the park are used to help fund projects in adjacent communities.

reviews.title: Great park and more!
reviews.text: Great place to visit! Amazing vistas and lots of green space and fountains. Very tranquil place. Recommend for all ages.

reviews.title: Beautiful Park.
reviews.text: It’s such a beautiful park in the middle of Cairo.  We loved the greenery and the fountains.  Our visit to the park was on Friday which is a day off for Egyptian and the park was buzzing with people. It was so nice to see families sitting together and children playing games and having fun. We must have seen 12 brides and grooms with photographers. It is the best green space in Cairo.  Very thankful to His Highness the Aga Khan for this amazing and beautiful garden.  Recommend it to everyone visiting Cairo.

reviews.title: Tranquil Park
reviews.text: An Oasis in the middle of Cairo.  H.H. the Aga Khan made this possible.  This park captures the true essence of the Fatimid period. A must visit for anyone visiting Cairo.  A true tranquil place to relax.

reviews.title: Lovely Green Oasis in a Chaotic City
reviews.text:
This place is a green lush oasis in unbearably hot Cairo in July. It's full of trees and shaded areas where numerous families were picnicking and having a good time 
We had lunch at their restaurant which has a stunning Arabesque decor and overlooks the park and Mohammad Ali Fort. The food was OK but nothing special.
Overall, it was a nice cool relaxing respite from a very noisy city.

reviews.title: Don't bring your camera
reviews.text: The park is beautiful, but for entering with my camera I had to pay 300 egp extra (about 12$). This seems like an easy way to make money from tourists - especially considering that entry costs are 25 egp ( 1.5$)

reviews.title: Wasteland before, waste of time and money now
reviews.text: Waste of time and money. There is almost nothing to do inside the park, but also the access points are very limited so you have to walk a lot. Besides this the camera fee is higher than the entry ticket making it completely unfair….. there are a lot of places to go, but this one is very very bad….

reviews.title: Dinner in Studio Masr at Al Azhar park.
reviews.text: Al Azhar park is a green place beside ancient Salah Aldeen citadel and Al Azhar mosque. The park is very clean and well organized.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: What a good park at the middle of the town 👏 👌 😍 perfect location nice views organized and easy to find very good time to enjoy with family

reviews.title: Beautiful Oasis with Historical Site
reviews.text:
Previously a garbage dump with some 500 years accumulation, the are was transformed to a green and tranquil oasis.  

Impressive gardens and fountains, well landscaped with a wide variety of plants.  

Three restaurants.

Scenic overlook of the Citadel.

The park is primarily designed with family outings in mind.

Why then should a foreign tourist come here when Cairo abounds in historic sites and museums?  Literally millennia of history and monuments.  So much that after multiple trips to Egypt we feel we have only begun to scratch the surface of what is here.

We came for the history. 1.5kms of Ayyubid Wall that have been restored.

Combine with another site?  
The Northern Cemetery --City of the Dead-- is across the street.  A rather fascinating place with historic monuments of its own among family tombs and the poor people living in them now.  A trip to the Park could be combined with a trip to the City of the Dead.  You'll probably want guide for that portion.

If you are interested in urban redevelopment of the good kind (improving the existing population's life rather than gentrification),  this is a living example of one way to do it.  The story of the project is recounted here.  You can also read about it on Wikipedia or Azhar Park's website.

reviews.title: Childish
reviews.text: Refreshing to see a park in this noisy smoggy city. Mainly children from school seen here. Nice for strolls.

reviews.title: A beautiful quiet green oasis in the middle of Cairo
reviews.text: In this park there are many shady places where you can recover from the traffic and the noise of the megacity. It's definitely worth the entrance fee.

reviews.title: Stunning and quiet
reviews.text: What a view! We were lucky and had almost no other people there. It is truly a lovely place to be and discover. Will return!

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: This is beautiful place in Cairo i love it .. place for relax  or picnic in nature ..rest in all day ..i muss see

reviews.title: Green oasis for the family
reviews.text: We recommend to visit this park just to enjoy beautiful green place, nice atmosphere apart of noisy city. The entrance was 25 LE for adults and 15 LE for kids. Picturesque views to old Cairo, Citadel and another part of the city. There is kids playground here and some cafes to spend time. You can bring your food with you and just sit on the grass - this is what local families do, making picnic in the fresh air.

reviews.title: A very nice nature retreat in Cairo
reviews.text: Beautiful well-maintained nature, the lakes and fountains, the most amazing views over old Cairo, its millions of minarets and the Citadel (picture attached), some very nice restaurants and a great handcraft shop held by the Aga Khan Foundation make this park a particular favorite of mine when we visit Cairo. Did you know it was built on top of Cairo’s “trash mountain”? I call this some great site rehabilitation, and environmentally-friendly on top of that. If you want to make a whole-day experience out of it, you could visit the nearby Citadel itself or get in touch with the Aga Khan Foundation beforehand to book their cultural visit of part of the surrounding area of old Cairo - they maintain quite a few gems nearby.

reviews.title: Um belo parque / A beautiful park
reviews.text:
Um grande parque localizado no coração do Cairo, é possível passar a tarde toda por lá.

A large park located in the heart of Cairo, it is possible to spend the whole afternoon there.

reviews.title: From dump to public park
reviews.text: The Al-Azhar Park is located near the historic Darb al-Ahmar district in east Cairo. It’s hard to imagine that these lush and beautifully landscaped public grounds were once a 500-year-old garbage dump! As part of an Islamic Cairo tour, our group watched a short video that described the ongoing transformation that included not only the development of the park but also quality of life improvements for the nearby neighborhood, historic building restoration, and excavation of the 12th century Ayyubid wall. What an amazing project! After touring several historic monuments and mosques in  Darb al-Ahmar, we returned to the park to have lunch at the Citadel View Studio Masr restaurant. We thoroughly enjoyed our day here and the opportunity to see everyday life as a local and not a tourist.

reviews.title: A beautiful green place to relax and forget the heat and dust of Cairo
reviews.text: Al-Azhar Park, Cairo was created by the Historic Cities Support Programme of the Aga Khan Trust for Culture. The park opened for sightseeing to the general public in the year 2005. Since then, the Al-Azhar Park has been fascinating people from all over the world with its beautiful plantations, terraced gardens, water fountains, Mamluk stonework comprising of multi-coloured stones, children play areas, a few restaurants, a lake, etc. Very nominal entry fee is applicable. I think it is better to visit the Park before noon, because the park gets overcrowded afterward.

reviews.title: Fantastic landscape
reviews.text: it is a lovely air breathe area you can escape too. lovely view from different angles of old Cairo. 15 minutes walk to Khan ElKhalili and Hussien area. Good cafes but service is not top-notch. Restaurants are perfectly situated but food quality is poor especially on Egyptian public occasions. You can go with your family and friends. kids' area may be crowded and poorly serviced They have good venues for business meetings.

reviews.title: peace and quiet
reviews.text: a beautiful place with lots of trees and fountains very peaceful and relaxing lots of places to eat from casual pizza place to upgraded fancier restaurant with a view of citadel

reviews.title: Quiet and peaceful in the chaos of cairo
reviews.text: After a busy morning at Giza it was lovely to sit at lunch in this green oasis.  After lunch we walked around the park. It was a great place to relax in a busy tour schedule.

reviews.title: A refreshing place in chaotic Cairo
reviews.text:
It’s a very nice park. A refreshing place to go to and have relaxing and quiet couple hours or so in a chaotic Cairo. As the city is lacking parks and green spaces, this park is almost the only place you can go to. It’s not free though. The entrance fee is 15-20 EGP. The good thing is it’s the same fee as locals, not like other touristy places where the tourists pay the highest fee comparing to the locals.
While you’re there, you might see the newly wed couples taking pictures, which is pretty cool.

reviews.title: Great place for a break
reviews.text: After touring the Citadel area, our guide took us to Al-Azhar Park. The Citadel View Restaurant has remarkably reasonable prices for juices and drinks! A great place for a break.

reviews.title: It's a Park..A nice Park but just a Park - See our video review
reviews.text: I'm not throwing shade on the park at all.  I'm just saying there are so many amazing unique things to see that a park probably doesn't justify the time.  We have a full video review if you'd like to know what to expect.  Just search YouTube for DOUGandNIKI and you'll find a whole Egypt playlist which includes this site.

reviews.title: Green, relaxing space in the city
reviews.text: If you've had enough of noise and are looking for a green space in which to relax, this park is a great option.  There are several cafes in which you can get something to eat, as well.

reviews.title: Neat
reviews.text: The lake, the weather, the tress and flowers along the eye sight is one of a great experiences what a park should be.

reviews.title: Anees
reviews.text: Peaceful and serene tranquil place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding areas, its a safe and clean place , definitely recommend to visit this place especially after a hectic experience in the khan e khalili market

reviews.title: Walk
reviews.text: It's a place to relax and walk. No flowers this time. Couples everywhere . It had children's play area. Overall missable .

reviews.title: A must visit
reviews.text:
This park, which is designed by the most prominent contemporary landscape architect of Egypt is a must visit. I was there at the afternoon through evening. I thin that is the best time to experience the sunset light behind the Islamic Cairo skyline, and on the trunks of the majestic Royal Palms. 
There are services and restaurants, but I did not use them. There is an entry fee that is of no consequence for a tourist’ budget, and well worth it. 
I have to say I visited on the weekend and the crowd was very decent. Unlike a visit before when it was summer vacation and a major holiday; then the crowd was overwhelming.

reviews.title: Well worth the entrance fee
reviews.text: At first, it was tough to find an entrance. I followed the parking cars and noticed an admission gate on the far side of the Darasa Garage. For non-locals, the admission was 20 EGP. In retrospect, that admission was well worth it! The park is beautiful and serene. It offers several higher vantage points that allow for great photos of the Cairo skyline in every direction. There are also two restaurants and several food/drink stalls. Definitely a great place to take a breather and relax on the lawn too!

reviews.title: Beautiful park in a crazy city
reviews.text: This is a great place to go for a walk and enjoy some quiet time from the crazy busy city of Cairo. There are several places to eat here as well.

reviews.title: Oasis in the dessert
reviews.text:
The park is a beautiful lost place you won't imagine can be found in a dessert city like El Cairo. Nice place to walk around and have a different view to the city from the viewpoint. 

Tip: in El Cairo ALWAYS dress modest (shoulders covered and no shorts). Is not mandatory but it'll save you a lot of unwanted looks from everyone.

reviews.title: Lunch at the restaurant if Al-Azhar park
reviews.text: We had lunch two time at the restaurant of Al-Azhar park you have a magnificent view on a nice garden (Versailles style) and on the back a Mosque. The food at the restaurant is very good Grillades of chicken, beef, kebab serve with rice and fries. We had lentils soup serve with warm bread.

reviews.title: LOVELY OASIS IN CAIRO
reviews.text: Spent a couple of hours here whilst on a tour of Cairo...its a lovely place to come and relax on the beautiful green lawns and take in the spectacular views over Cairo.  It really is an oasis in the middle of dirty, dusty Cairo.

reviews.title: They call it the new lungs of old cairo
reviews.text: This park has amazing views of the Citadel as well as the Pyramids. Lots of cool restaurants and has concerts year round but check their schedule.

reviews.title: Nice oasis in the city
reviews.text: We came late afternoon after visiting Bazaar Khan Khalili. It is a very nice park and such an oasis in the middle of busy Cairo. Beautiful sunset in the lake with beautiful mosque and citadel in the background

reviews.title: An Oasis in Cairo
reviews.text: This park was a wonderful change of pace at the end of our day of touring Cairo. We visited on a Friday so it was full of people sitting on the grass having picnics, brides getting their pictures taken, and families just walking around.

reviews.title: Beautiful Park
reviews.text: This is a lovely, very popular park. It has beautiful views 360 degrees around it. Well manicured. Bathrooms are available and clean- but need to buy tissues (2 LE). Food and drinks are available. A must see park, well worth the tiny entrance fee.

reviews.title: The perfect escape
reviews.text: It is the perfect place to escape from the chaotic Cairo. Being settled in an iconic place amid the Islamic Cairo,it is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the view of the city and the beautiful sunset.

reviews.title: Nice photo ops
reviews.text: Very nice spot with lots of potential for great photos in front of the palace.  If you go at night you’ll be able to take beautiful pics, it’s well-lit.  It was fun to watch the children play and interact, too.  Great intro to local culture.

reviews.title: My favourite
reviews.text:
Very beautiful park, comfortable walkways and really beautiful views. 
There is a parking with enough places.
A great place to visit

reviews.title: Oasis in the city
reviews.text:
We wondered this lovely park after a very generous lunch. The restaurant boasts an amazing view of the citidel.

We enjoyed strolling with families and sweethearts. It was the most amazing view of the city. 

The park was very cool with interesting viewpoints

reviews.title: AL Azhar Park A must see in Cairo
reviews.text: This park is awesome. One of the nicest places in Cairo. It is a huge landscape with flowers, gardens and natural water places. You can find restaurants that serve oriental and western foods. A magnificent place to visit in summer and winter. If you travel to Cairo. Don't miss your chance to visit this park

reviews.title: Very good park
reviews.text: The atmosphere and views were awesome there, the entrance ticket is 20 LE and there's a parking with fees.

reviews.title: Very underrated park
reviews.text: First of all there are both entry and parking fees to this place which is a shame but can understandable once inside as it is well maintained and very nice. There are areas with palm trees, children play areas, a few restaurants, a lake, fountains and lots of greenery. You can go on a picnic here, or a walk/run, it just a great to get a break from the hectic city of Cairo.

reviews.title: Nice break from monuments in Cairo
reviews.text: Liked the park. Has a good mix of fountains, greenery, colorfull trees, ponds, Date palm trees etc. Great views of the citadel and Islamic cairo. Nice Cafes/restaurants. Took a break from the monuments etc. in Cairo to spend an afternoon here. There is the old Ayyubid era wall for the history buffs. Overall a relaxing afternoon well spent.

reviews.title: The best part of the city
reviews.text: This park was such a pleasant surprise. Everything was so calm and pleasant. Well kept and good restaurants. I went on a quite day and it was the best thing I did in Cairo. Love to go back to the park with family in winter.

description: Once known as the Roman stronghold of Babylon, Cairo’s oldest section is the ancient heart of the Coptic Christian community featuring five original churches, the first mosque built in Egypt and the oldest synagogue, all representing three of the major world religions.

reviews.title: lovely area
reviews.text: this is definitely a lovely area to walk around and explore. It would have been nice if we had time to linger, I think. But there are many old churches here and some significant "holy" sites.

reviews.title: Historic area
reviews.text:
Historic and unique area in Cairo. Very interesting to learn the history of the Coptic community. Church of the Cavern and St George’s are lovely. Can get quite crowded in the narrow alleys and small churches. It’s a compact walkable area. The Coptic Museum building is beautiful inside; one can go through it quite quickly unless there is a deep interest in Coptic textiles, books, etc. 
A shame that the ruins of the Roman Tower were closed off.

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: when in cairo this is a mustt,amazing experience and very safe.the ancient churches are something not to miss.

reviews.title: Nice place to visit
reviews.text:
Lots of history down all the alley ways, explore early Christianity churches etc, best to go with guide, not the best signage.

Very well maintained for age of buildings and alley ways.

Don’t forget at the back to explore some of the early cemeteries.

reviews.title: Brilliant place to explore a different part of Cairo
reviews.text: Amazing experience, friendly locals. Found is calm and away from the hustle and bustle. There's some lovely cafes tucked away by the walled section.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text:
When visiting Cairo this is a must !
It is relatively clean and safe.
Unlike many areas of Cairo this place is well maintained and has many interesting Christian places to visit.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: Coptic Cairo is a historic and fascinating neighborhood in Cairo that offers a unique glimpse into the history of early Christianity in Egypt. The area is home to several ancient churches, monasteries, and other important religious sites, including the Hanging Church and the Church of St. George. The architecture is beautiful and well-preserved, offering visitors a look into the rich cultural heritage of this area. The atmosphere is peaceful and serene, providing a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of modern-day Cairo. The staff and guides are knowledgeable and always willing to provide additional information about the historical and religious significance of the sites. Overall, I highly recommend visiting Coptic Cairo for anyone interested in exploring the early Christian history of Egypt. Whether you're a history buff or simply looking for a unique cultural experience, this neighborhood is sure to leave a lasting impression.

reviews.title: Nice architecture
reviews.text: Worth visiting - lovely architecture and nice to be somewhere enclosed and touristy, feels like a little escape from the madness that is Cairo. We stopped and had a lovely and delicious falafel etc lunch in a touristy cafe in the sun.

reviews.title: You can visit without a guide
reviews.text: One of the few places in Cairo where it's possible to visit fairly easily via Uber and without a guide. St George's hanging church is magnificent and there are many interesting smaller churches such as those devoted to Philomena. It is very peaceful and easy to walk around. Don't miss the stairs going down leading to a corridor with many books where there are even more churches. One of the venues supposedly housed the Holy Family. Great thing to do on Christmas.

reviews.title: Congested, dirty city and scam tours
reviews.text: We were very shocked by the congestion and how dirty the city was. It is impossible to cross the street anywhere without risking your life. You must eat at a hotel restaurant to be safe. Be very wary of hiring tour guides even through very high end hotels. We stayed at a very exclusive hotel and not only were the private cars we hired old and dirty, the drivers and/or guides were either taking us to places they wanted in order to get kickbacks or pushing scams. Scams are everywhere and the aggressive manner of demanding tips or to buy things is extreme. Overall, if you really want to go see the pyramids, go for a day or two tops. Be very prepared to only go and do what YOU want and not what is “suggested” or forced on you. And be extremely cautious of the Sultan Lotus Oil and perfume palace. Total scam and extremely uncomfortable situation.

reviews.title: Dispointed and mesled
reviews.text:
I took a tour of 4 hours, 2 islamic cairo and 2 hours coptic Cairo. The two hours in islamic Cairo were ok. I had many explanations. After we went to Coptic Cairo…. And we stayed only 40 minutes. The time to see the hanging Church and nothing else (ex. Museum, streets, synagogue).
I was misled into a “papyrus museum “ that was by no way a museum but a shop for tourists to buy expensive papyrus. Be careful, they don’t tell you anything but put prices in dollars!! 50 dollars for an A4 papyrus. Of course I didn’t buy because i didn’t like the approach and the fact to be misled. I was also taken to a perfume shop (tge guide told me to sit there while he was going to pray). I eventually bought a perfume … but be careful it is again in dollars and you have to bargain a lot and firmly.
I didn’t like it overall. I bought a cultural tour and felt trapped into unwanted shopping.
I also didn’t like the familiarity of the guide. I am a woman, solo traveller, over 50, and had the impression to be a piece of meat 🥩.

reviews.title: Surprised by Coptic Cairo
reviews.text: This is an incredible part of Cairo and Egyptian history. Our guide, Magib from Civitatis tour was super informative and knowledgeable which helped us understand the area and the history. The Coptic Museum was also worthwhile not only due to the museum pieces at display but also the beautiful building with elaborated ceilings.

reviews.title: Coptic Cairo and Fustat Souq
reviews.text: Coptic Cairo is such a holy site visited by Jesus christ and moses I loved the spirituality of the place which also has the first mosque in Africa to the mosque of Amr Ibn El Ass if you go therei recommend to visit the souq of Al Fustat

reviews.title: DIVINE AND MAGICAL
reviews.text:
We visited this divinely beautiful place with GATE 1 TOURS! RIHAM and NEHAL were our tour operators and we were very impressed with their level of competence , professionalism , friendliness , care and willingness to ALWAYS be there for us 24/7! 

COPTIC CAIRO was magical ! The Hanging Church , The Ben Ezra synagogue where baby MOSES was flung and .., The place were THE HOLY FAMILY stayed - BACCHUS CHURCH were absolutely magnificent! 
We could feel the divinity .. 
The churches were spectacular in their beauty of course 

Lunch at SKY RIM was fantastic with an amazing view of Cairo ! 

CITADEL OF CAIRO  with Mohamed Ali magnificent mosque was the delightful way of ending this magical day ! 

Thank you Gate 1. 

Thanking also MARINA PONOCEVNAIA who arranged every small detail for us so thoroughly… we were 57 of us in all! 

And Aharoni Zisling who initiated the whole tour for us !

reviews.title: Old Cairo
reviews.text: Full of character and vibrant, love the history and people. Enjoyed the trip down centuries of history of Coptic churches, culture and buzzing markets

reviews.title: The holy family and Cairo
reviews.text:
Walking through this part of Cairo through the various right alleys helps you understand the Christian in Cairo.
You will learn the stories of how Egypt was the place of escape and where a church is built wherever Jesus stayed on his travels. 
Many of these churches are small but nevertheless beautifully maintained and still working churches today.
Not a must see but does help you understand more of the history of Cairo in the 1st century AD.

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.text: The old churches are definitely worth seeing. The neighborhood has quite a few little shops cafés. Belt less touristy than other areas.

reviews.title: Must see for any Christian visiting Egypt
reviews.text: Beautiful churches, and places where christianity has its roots. The cavern where the holy family stayed after a flight from Bethlehem is one of the few places where Jesus stayed outside of the Holy Land. This one the highlight of our Cairo visit, in addition to Cave church.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text:
Great place to visit- a lovely old street with lovely coffee shops and quiet restaurants.
Lovely old churches with great architecture

reviews.title: Worth hiring a guide
reviews.text:
Fascinating tour with my colleagues and our guide.  Great insights into the history of the area and it’s associations with Christianity, Judaism and Islam. 

Busy but worth preserving to see this important area of the city

reviews.title: Egyptian Treasures in Cairo
reviews.text:
Great break for 5 nights, 6 days. We stayed in hotel in front of the Pyramid’s, lovely experience eating breakfast and evening meal looking over the Pyramids from the rooftop restaurant.
Plus in the evenings they have a light show lighting up the Pyramids, to us it was free as we overlooked the Pyramids from the hotel.
The Pyramids are amazing to see close up, they are still excavating on the sight today.
We visited a few Mosques and churches, the 2 cave churches were unbelievable to see.
We also took a visit to Alexandria on the Mediterranean coast, that was nice too.
We saw lots of Egyptian treasures visiting different sites, the new Museum is amazing, also the new Library.

reviews.title: Interesting look into the world of vanishing Coptic Catholics in Egypt
reviews.text: We visited the church and surrounding area just as a christening was being finalised in the Church, but we managed to see the art works and appreciate the architecture, as well as being welcomed by the family of the child being christened.  It was just a happy coincidence which made our visit more memorable.

reviews.title: Amazing inlaid mother of pearl jewelry boxes and other very high-quality souvenirs.
reviews.text: Enjoying the morning in this easily walkable 5000-year-old Christian cultural center of Cairo is important to understand the whole history of Egypt. The streets are decorated in frescos and include many small, very old and amazing churches still in use today including the Hanging Church and the Greek Church of St. George. You are able to visit the actual site where Joseph and Mary lived for a time hiding Jesus during Herod's slaughter of the innocents. Inside the walls and twisting cobblestone pathways is a large shop filled with the most high-quality souvenirs we found in all of Egypt including jewelry, statutes and Lapis carvings. The store is run as a fund-raising arm to support Christan's locally so guides are not motivated to bring you shopping there and unfortunately, they do not have a website, but rest assured it cannot be missed as it is clearly the largest of the shops.

reviews.title: Interesting history, very cool interior
reviews.text: Highly suggest a guide unless you know the history! it was cool on a very hot day, which was lovely.

reviews.title: A special part of Cairo snd Egypt - a good break from temples
reviews.text:
We had a great visit to the churches in Coptic Cairo as part of our Egypt tour with Overseas Adventure Travel. 

It was incredible to see in the Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church the cave where the Holy Family stayed for three months during the Flight to Egypt. The church, built in the 4th century when Christianity became the official religion of the Roman Empire, is beautiful with stunning icons. There is a lovely latticework through which you can enter the congregation.

The Hanging Church is so named as it was built over a Roman fortress, which you can see as you approach the church. If I understand it correctly the Hanging Church is the seat of the Coptic Papacy, 

Churches have the same design as temples form of temples with the “holy of holies”/altar only available to the priest.  The altar is in a private room that is closed off and in front of the congregation. The priest’s words are broadcast to the congregation. 

Our guide being Copt provided special insight into the history and liturgy of the Copt faith and these specific churches. 

What is especially poignant are the parallels between the ancient Egyptian religion and Christianity. All we learned during visits to the ancient Egyptian temples, tombs and pyramids about rebirth, virgin birth, rebirth from an enclosed stone tomb, three gods; father, son and spirit; son of god in form of a man made the adoption of Christianity by Egyptians relatively easy. 

I had always thought that Christianity’s roots were in the Old Testament with the foretelling of Christ in the book is Isaiah. Now I see the deep roots and influence of the Ancient Egyptian religion on Christianity.

If you have any interest in the history of Christianity, Coptic Cairo is a must see, 

An extra treat was walking by the Ben Ezra Synagogue at the site where baby Moses was retrieved from the Nile. 

Our appreciation for Copt Cairo was enhanced greatly by the explanations by our excellent guide Osama Petro.  I strongly urge visitors to do research in the Copt faith and/or go with a guide. 

Coptic Cairo is a good respite from the activity and intensity of Cairo.

reviews.title: Fascinating church Complex
reviews.text: Well worth a visit, to wander around and stumble across various churches eg the one which includes the cave where holy family rested!   All highly evocative of an old religion, seemingly little changed.

reviews.title: Well worth  a visit
reviews.text: Both the Coptic Church  and Museum were not on our 'Must See' list, but we were so glad we were taken as both were fascinating and interesting.

reviews.title: Get a guide and do a half day tour of the area.
reviews.text: This is a lovely part of Cairo. Like a different world away from the chaotic roads nearby! I would say to take a guide as you will miss a lot of the history and important attractions which are 'dotted' around. A good idea is to do a half day guided tour. Very interesting and we learnt a lot.

reviews.title: RELIGIOUS HISTORY
reviews.text: Lots of religious history here including about the Coptic Christians, of which I knew almost nothing. I bought a book in English that explained their history. I did some reading from the book when I got back to my hotel room. Don't miss this site.

reviews.title: A short trip to the Christian bastion
reviews.text: It is a lovely area of the Cairo City where the Coptic Christians live for thousands of years. It houses churches where Jesus Christ along with his mother stayed for sometime. The area oozes history . The area has narrow alleys with book and souvenir shops for visitors .

reviews.title: Different atmosphere that one would not expect in Islamic Cairo
reviews.text: Hanging church, Babylon fortress and Mar Girgius church are places worth to visit. Synagogue Ben Ezra is closed due to reconstruction. Our guide Mahmoud +20 122 8232071 provided us with many interesting background details about Coptic and Christian.

reviews.title: Oldest part of Cairo
reviews.text: Must see when in Cairo. Our guide told us it is the oldest part of Cairo. A lot of fascinating churches, buildings and history.

reviews.title: Not just for the religious
reviews.text: I went into this experience skeptical because I am not very religious anymore. But with the help of our guide I was able to understand a lot more about the significance of the neighborhood. You need a good guide (not guidebook) to advise what you need to understand. Truly loved walking the alleyways seeing the street book vendors. They led to the Hanging Church and the Cavern Church, which are brilliant. Look inside, sit and meditate. Ben Ezra synagogue was closed for renovations when we were there and our guide did not bring us to other churches, though I wish we had time.I was inspired.

reviews.title: Compact area with several churches
reviews.text: This area is conveniently reachable via the Metro (Mar Girgis station). The St. Sergius and St. Bacchus church is built over the underground chamber where the Holy Family is believed to have lived in Egypt.

reviews.title: Unique experience - get to know one of the oldest Christian denominations
reviews.text:
Fascinating part of Cairo. Coptic language is basically as close as linguistically possible to the old Egyptian language before the Arabic influence. It uses not the hieroglyphs but the Greek alphabet. It is used in Coptic liturgy. It also helped Jean-Francois Champollion decipher the ancient hieroglyphs.
Visiting the Coptic Cairo is mostly a walking tour featuring the old Coptic churches and the museum.
Do not miss the 5th century Abu Serba where you can decent to the cave that had sheltered the Holy Family during their flight to the Egypt . Another interesting objective of the tour is exploration of the “hanging church” from 7th century.
During the walk you will see many interesting icons, walk by many bookineers and decent to the lower levels of the ancient Cairo.

reviews.title: Not convenient place
reviews.text: You have to walk a lot. Come from a lot traffic. Difficult with strollers and nobody helps. Language barrier is huge even in entire Cairo. Things can be better managed.

reviews.title: Splendid place and great guide Mr Yasser
reviews.text:
We had visited site in the morning and had a very good luck to be suggested to have a tour with the local guide. His name is Mr Yasser and he did a very good job. We were really happy with the tour and knowledge provided. Highly recommended to ask about him and enjoy the tour as much as we did.
Very interesting area, worth of visiting!

reviews.title: Interesting part of Cairo's history
reviews.text: Walking thru Coptic Cairo, you get a glimpse of the Byzantine influence in the various remaining religious sites. There is a strong police presence here for obvious reasons but we had no issues with them nor the locals (as expected).

reviews.title: Great with the exception of police harassment
reviews.text:
I would give this five stars, but we walked in with two Egyptian friends and the police immediately started asking questions and took the papers of our friend.  We explained that we wanted to hire a guide and that we were not with guides but that did not stop the harassment.  
We were not even allowed to have our friends come into a shop with us due to the police intervention.
Once we got through all the hassle and hired a guide, we had a wonderful visit to this amazing place.  We visited the Hanging Church, Church of St Sergius,etc.  This was created about the fourth century AD, and is amazing well taken care of.
I would definitely hire a guide, as there really is not any information provided and you would not get a full picture.  Be aware that the churches close at any time, and much earlier than posted online or on the signs.

reviews.title: Interesting walk through history
reviews.text: This is one area of Cairo to get out of a vehicle for a while and simply walk the streets and alleys to get a sense of the history here. Several interesting religious sites.

reviews.title: Very nice place!
reviews.text: I am very happy I could visit Coptic Cairo in my touristic tour! I liked all the parts of this amazing place with great history and it brought me a so much excitement. I felt like I was taken back to hundred years ago!

reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.text: We visited it in an afternoon. Apart from walking through the narrow streets, have also visited several churches steeped in history and tradition. Some churches close in early afternoon, and despite posted schedules, they all seemed to close even earlier.

reviews.title: Exceptional tour!
reviews.text:
Exceptional tour!!  Our guide, Moses, is educated and  personable.  Knowledgeable of ancient Egypt and modern..  He easily answered any questioned we asked and told us the Muslim version of the "death" of Jesus and end times.  In addition, we enjoyed cactus fruit, water, and a fresh mango smoothie plus a delicious lunch. 
 Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Highlight is the Church of Saint Sergius
reviews.text: We visited several parts of Coptic Cairo, but our favorite by far was the Church of Saint Sergius, where Jesus, Mary, and Joseph are said to have stopped. There was a lot of interesting and ancient detail inside this church also. The other stops, including the hanging church, didn’t seem as original or interesting to us.

reviews.title: No cost attraction
reviews.text:
This place was not on our original itinerary, but was
Recommended by our tour guide and we’re so happy we went. There was no charge to get in, but I’d definitely recommend a guide because if not you could get easily lost and miss something. Here you can see the oldest church, the hanging church and a synagogue.

reviews.title: Take your time to explore
reviews.text: This was by far one of my fav spots in Cairo. No tourists, we were alone to discover the area all by ourselves. Breathtaking!

reviews.title: Old Cairo area
reviews.text: before Khan El Kalili round we visited this old area that contains a lot of churches. the very nice place also visited ben Ezra synnaguge

reviews.title: Jesus Pilgrimage COVID-19 style trip and sightseeing
reviews.text:
The Coptic church is absolutely beautiful.  It was created out of the mountain literally moved by God in 725 a.d.  to this location.  There was a church service going on when we got there. Our driver Ahmed was punctual and started our day off with a delicious Egyptian breakfast and helped my husband obtain cigarettes.  

Our guide Ehab was punctual and knowledgeable as always. We have been blessed to get him and Ahmed on most of our tours.  WAHOO!!!!  Ask for these two awesome people if you want to have a wonderful and informative vacation  tour (Sherif Hasheem tours)

reviews.title: Tour with Egyptologist Marwa Ghazal
reviews.text:
I was so very glad I'd not missed this treasure trove of history with my unbelievably gifted and knowledgeable guide Marwa. It was easily a top highlight for me.  Marwa is an expert at opening this treasure trove: 
 marwa_ghazal@hotmail.com, +20 100 669 0255 whatsapp or phone;

reviews.title: Very interesting glimpse into a different Cairo
reviews.text: Very pretty and impressive buildings and churches. Everything very clean and people ever so friendly. Worth spending a few hours to include the excellent museum

The Mall is not good for many people as it has low capacity in comparison with other malls in Egypt (Also Made By Al Fatim)

My visit to Cairo festival moll was marked by the meeting of The most reliable, Punctual l ,frie

reviews.title: MASSIVE
reviews.text: This mall is excellent with free wifi and great numbr of shops, however a bit far from central Cairo but worth a visit

reviews.title: New life in Cairo
reviews.text: Very good place to spend one day  shopping and very good restaurants and coffee shop   . Really it is worth to visit this mall really it new Egypet

reviews.title: One of the Best Malls in Cairo! I 🛍🕶👗⌚️💍👖💄📚 👝👔 👜🩱🎁👞
reviews.text: I love Festival City! It's very big and expansive. There are so many well known international brands and other nice local shops, stands, stalls and kiosks as well. There's also a big Carrefour, Cinema, Banks and numerous services. It's one of the 'newer' Malls in the New Cairo area. It's worth mentioning that designer brands and apparel are not available in Festival City Mall. Was pleased to see that the Mall connects to Ikea- (one of my favorite places to wonder in). The best thing about this Mall is the Food Court, which has tons of options. There are about 4 locations for Kids Entertainment, including Magic Planet, a bounce hall and obstacle course-like place. I adore 'The Village' area of the mall, which has lots of wonderful restaurants, (casual, as well as formal) and that beautiful fountain in the center. It has multiple floors and is quite well maintained, except for the toilets, which can be dirty even though they are being constantly cleaned. Everyone should endeavour to visit Festival City Mall. It's one of the best Shopping Malls in Cairo! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼

reviews.title: The best mall in Cairo
reviews.text:
One of the best malls in Cairo, located in new Cairo, have all type of activity, shopping, dining restaurants, and playing places for kids.
Must visit and highly recommended

reviews.title: Overwhelming amount of people
reviews.text:
There were lots of people to the point the security roped off places to prevent people from sitting and hanging out. It was overwhelming the amount of people here. I live in the US so I didn’t go to shop but I am
On. A mission to buy scarves, and stuff I can’t find in the US. Tie shop was a store I wanted to visit but it was a 7 foot stand so I didn’t find what I needed. 

I would go to eat but this isn’t an outing to enjoy you are fighting for a spot to stand and move around. I was with a friend and we couldn’t walk side by side.

reviews.title: Beautifully designed - expansive - lots of dining options - nice musical fountain - plenty of parking
reviews.text: Sizzler and Paul were my 2 favorite places to eat in my 3.5 year stay (2018-21)- will require 3 to 4 hours to cover- all high end to medium brands - European, American, Turkish & Egyptian brands

reviews.title: Pleasant mall with ample shops and restaurants
reviews.text: A clean, well maintained  mall with some major retailers also at the back there is a restaurant area outside with fountains, the place is a breath of fresh air from the usual busy and hectic sometimes filthy Cairo suburbs.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: I like this mall really its very good i like everything the restaurant , people,alote of shops with good quality and service

reviews.title: Great visit
reviews.text: Fantastic mall for shopping. Provides great options with good prices. Entertainment offered is great with many food options

reviews.title: Best Mall in Cairo
reviews.text: Awesome mall has two part indoor with all international brands and outdoor with a beautiful area to set and see the dancing fountain. Highly recommend in central location and near to Cairo international airport

reviews.title: An international shopping mall with funny security
reviews.text: A nice shopping mall with good restaurants. Unfortunately with unprofessional security, yesterday we had lunch in the mall after a seightseeing tour, they let me in and with my pocket camera in my backpack, today we came again and this idiots wanted to keep the batterie of the camera at security, at the entrance there is a sticker showing noprofessional cameras allowed. Started to argue as its was no professional equipment. But they dont understand english, just showed them how stupid they are and took my reserve batteries out of the backpack and left this idiots.. dont bring your tiny camera with you or take it into your pants pockets and you will have no issues.

reviews.title: Nice Mall
reviews.text: This mall is so beautiful and spacious. I enjoyed myself there. Everything is organised and it's not too expensive. It is really a nice place to visit. Because of its height and size, it's advisable to move along especially with visiting group or families. Nevertheless,  it is also accessible for people on wheelchair

reviews.title: It's a mall
reviews.text: We popped in on the way to the airport and it really is like every other mall in the Middle East. Same shops, food outlets, even the logo! I guess if you know what you are going for it might be useful but these are mostly westernised shops with very little of interest. You are in Cairo. Go do something interesting.

reviews.title: Great mall
reviews.text: The place is easy to find, very accessible. COVID-19 precautions are in place although inside the mall some of the visitors take off their masks. Place was very clean. Eating area was large enough. All brands are there.

reviews.title: strange logistics and horrible shopping experience
reviews.text:
Cairo festival city had some strange rules that make it very difficult to shop easily:
1. Today they didn't allow my uber captain to come through the mall car park to my location at one of the designated stops for uber. the uber captain called me and asked that I had to walk completely outside the car park. so I had to carry all my shopping (was large number of heavy bags) as well as carrying my son and walk a very long distance until i reached all the way out of the huge car park. when I enquired at the security at the gate, they said it was the management instructions not to allow uber or careem inside the car park of the mall!! very weird to expect the client to carry all the shopping and walk such a long distance. 

2. Once you do the shopping at Carrefour and have all your groceries in the trolley, you are not allowed to shop through the rest of the mall with the shopping trolley. you are expected to carry your shopping bags from Carrefour while shopping through the rest of the mall (eg clothes and getting meals). no trolleys allowed throughout the mall. again very weird logistics that would force you to leave the mall once you do your Carrefour shopping!!!

never seen any of that in any other mall in Cairo or other overseas countries.

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.text: I love this place ... beautiful.. clean .. you can find everything you want there . Best shops. Best places to eat ... just perfect . I can't wait to go there again

reviews.title: Tamara Cairo Festival
reviews.text:
Clean wonderful place.. The food is delicious and yummy..The staff is active and friendly..We were lucky to have someone called Mostafa ,who was extremely active and very helpful in serving.. Sanitizers on the tables and all waiters with their masks on...The view is amazing and cheerful.. 
The menu is full of tasty  kind of food with a big variety...

reviews.title: safe place
reviews.text: Very clean, corona precautions are in place, definitely safe place to go to for shopping. we were impressed, even food court is in order. dont hesitate, visit.

reviews.title: Cairo visit
reviews.text: Cairo Festival City Mall, one of the nice places to visit,  , nice, clean,  many choices for shopping,  delicious food available at many restaurants.

reviews.title: Give yourself all day to enjoy everything
reviews.text:
A huge Mall with many big name stores all under the same roof, and then more in separate locations all on the same overall plot.

The main Mall has three floors of shops selling everything from home furniture, to clothes, electronice, toys and coffee shops.  If you cnnot find what you want or need, then you reall are not looking!!

reviews.title: Wonderful walk.
reviews.text:
It is wonderful mall, many shops with variety of restaurant and coffee shops. 
You get introduced to different kind of culture and people in the mall.

reviews.title: Top Excellent Mall in cairo
reviews.text: Very  big Mall with all the facilities.  Excellent design,  Excellent parking,  excellent  service,  excellent  respect.  Many thanks to all team, many thanks to the management. I strongly recommend this Mall for everyone to visit and enjoy the facilities.

reviews.title: For shopping lovers
reviews.text:
It's nice to visit that mall, mainly for those who love shopping, also it's suitable to visit it on a rainy day.
hundreds of shops and restaurants are available, also there are the dancing fountains outside.
Many other famous shops are there too like Ikea, decathlon...

reviews.title: A global mall in a great country
reviews.text: A world-class mall where you can spend a beautiful day with all your purchases, restaurants and entertainment - I highly recommend visiting it when you come to the Great Egypt

reviews.title: Wonderful visit
reviews.text:
The Cairo Festival City Market is a wonderful place. Many wonderfully made local items for sell at easily reduced prices. Many items are being sold by the creators. Special orders can be placed but I recommend paying no more than a third down on special orders. If you have been able to agree on a very low price for the custom piece consider paying half down in order to cheer up the creator. 

Many items I bought there were able to be shipped home from the market without me having to bother with transporting them back to the apartment.

reviews.title: The Best Mall in Cairo!
reviews.text: I love Festival City! It's very big and expansive. There are so many well known brands and other  nice local shops and kiosks as well. There's also a big Carrefour and cinema. Was pleased to see that the mall connects to Ikea, (one of my favorite places to wonder in). The best thing about this mall is the food court. It's massive! There are sooooo many options, from international eateries to local delicacies. Awesome, awesome mall. I highly recommend it!!!

reviews.title: Best mall in Cairo
reviews.text: The best mall in Cairo with a beautiful lay out. Great variety of stores and famous brands from all over the world. Nice variety of restaurants, also with a beautiful fountain view. Very clean and well maintained. Offers lots of activities also for families.

reviews.title: Huge westernized mall beautiful lay out
reviews.text: This is the posh mall in Cairo. It has all the leading brands with the leading brand prices. The mall is easy to maneuver as the halls are wide. It is a very clean mall. On the outside by the beautiful fountain display are variety of nice restaurants. Enjoy a day shopping and then eating as evening comes especially on the weekend the mall gets packed.

reviews.title: Does the Basics Right, But does the "Hard Stuff" Right too!
reviews.text:
As a Family, we need the basics to be right- the bathrooms were clean and well marked, there was minimal smoking inside the main mall area, and everything was spotlessly clean. Festival City Mall seems to out of the way to enforce the basics. It is true that outside in the Village area, all the workers are taking smoke breaks and it is impossible to sit outside for all the smokers, but the inside seating areas are always available and smoke free. Thus, the basics are right.

Malls always struggles to be all things to all people, but Festival City Mall also does well here. The usual name brands are available, but we could stop into Carrefour for a few grocery items, stop in three different toy stores for our youngest, and choose from a wide range of restaurants for lunch. Really is all things for all people- we plan on either climbing or Bouncing next time we pass through.

reviews.title: Unfortunately
reviews.text:
Like all successful places start very beautiful and then become worse over time.
The dancing fountain and the music became very boring and it takes a very long time to work, the price of the restaurants is expensive with no really good service or the perfect spot Previous

reviews.title: Almost all what you need in this nice mall
reviews.text: Everything is available in this mall: Restaurants some of them are facing the dancing fountain, fast food area which are very crowded most of the time, Cinema, Theatre, kids playing area, hypermarket, apparel stores, furniture stores …etc.

reviews.title: Smooking everywhere
reviews.text:
A great mall but at each door or exit or bathroom, u will find few people smoking, i found a janitor ( Hamdy Atta) in the bathroom beside the pray area smoking and when i asked for his supervisor ( Hatem Hussein) he said that it is back area so smoking is ok. Really so unresponsive attitude.

Train for kids are very nice

reviews.title: Cairo
reviews.text: A good place for families nice food and people you can spend four to five hours there and enjoy cinema with many choices

reviews.title: CFC
reviews.text: It is a good mall for family but it seems to always be very very busy at noisy I personally don't think that it's THE BEST OF THE BEST but it's ok for a city mall.

reviews.title: Great Mall
reviews.text: Very big and nice shopping mall with lots of outlets and departments stores. There is even an Ikea. There is a nice indoor food court, as well as a standalone restaurants. Entertainment is also available. Very nice and clean facilities as well.

reviews.title: Shopping
reviews.text:
My favorite place to make shopping 
And eat and meet friends 
Huge parking ..
And  it had variety of coffeeshops and restaurants 
So interesting place

reviews.title: Cairo festival mall
reviews.text: Nice mall and have many good shops and Movie theater, also there are many type of reasturnts , and coffee shops

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: In general it is a good place. Contains Some world class trade marks. Many ATM, banks and lots of restaurants. So crowded specially during occasions and public holidays.

reviews.title: Tour of Cairo Festival City Mall
reviews.text: This was a very exciting experience. Many interesting stores. I highly recommend the Mobile Outfitters Clear Coat phone protection. Very large eating area with lot's of choice. Love it!

reviews.title: Nice mall
reviews.text: CFCM is a mall located in the 5th settlement, not far from the airport. It has brand shopping as well as street wise shopping. U can find Zara, H&M, Debenhams, Marks & Spencer, Ted Baker, Tommy Hilfiger, Polo Ralph Lauren, ... Also Ikea & Carrefour. It has a food court, cinema, fun fair, & lots of cafes like Starbucks & Paul. It also has a great outdoor area with a fountain. It boasts a great selection of restaurants serving all cuisines. U can dine while watching the light & music fountain show. It has several entrances & parking lots.

reviews.title: Review on Ilea Cairo
reviews.text: It was a very bad visit to Cairo Festival City Ikea due to employees , they are absent in all sections, the one who happened to help us purchase 3 bedrooms with large wardrobes that need to be designed had a very strange attitude that resulted in that we only let her help us in one design room and we left without completing our purchase, actually I’ll go buy my rooms from another store if this is the attitude at IKEA Egypt. What is very surprising is that 3 years ago we bought 3 rooms for another house and the employees were far more trained and of better attitude. I believe that the employee who helped us needs training.

reviews.title: Wonderful mall of Cairo festival city mall
reviews.text:
I love it as it is big size mall but not huge, shop from shop opposite it won't be too far distance. 
 
  Mall is clean, washroom is clean, every where you don't find bad smell. People are nice, both indoor shop and outdoor shop and restaurant. 
 
  Less local brand, most are international brand , from LC wakiki, H & M, Zara, Massimo dutti, Ted Baker, Polo Ralph Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger,  Gerry Weber, carre four,  debenhams , there should be over 50restaurant I guess and food court , any kind of food you can find here , even Japan, Chinese, Asian. I have been to Sun City mall in March, but bad experience, overall this is my favorite style mall in Cairo. You go without regret.

reviews.title: One stop shopping
reviews.text: Cairo Festival city mall has all the renowned brands under one roof. The prices are quite above the range but the quality speaks volumes.

reviews.title: Nice mall
reviews.text: Nice mall  and you will find all the leading brands. Too many people and difficult to find a parking space. The outdoor area is too good

reviews.title: Beautiful place
reviews.text:
Nice place, lots of variety of food. Good service.
Sushi = Mori Sushi and Cafe Supreme
Fine dining= Eatery

name: Khan Al-Khalili
