ranking_subcategory: #27 of 288 things to do in Cairo
subcategory_ranking: #27 of 288 things to do in Cairo
ranking: #27 of 288 things to do in Cairo
description:
This vibrant open-air bazaar is a treasure trove of Egyptian culture, with bustling streets filled with local artisans and vendors. Here, you can pick up unique souvenirs like spices and perfumes, or simply soak up the local atmosphere. And don't forget to haggle for the best bargains. The best time to go is in the morning before the crowds arrive and the weather gets too hot. Take a break from the shopping and pay a visit to El-Fishawi Cafe, one of Cairo's oldest, for a cup of tea or coffee. 

To learn more about the bazaar's rich history, join a walking tour to discover fascinating stories and insights from a knowledgeable guide. – Tripadvisor

offer_list.title: 8-Hour Private Tour of the Pyramids, Egyptian Museum and Bazaar from Cairo
Private Walking Tour to Khan el-Khalili and Madrassa of Sultan Hassan
Guided Visit to Cairo's Khan el-Khalili Market with Koshary dish
Private Guided Night Tour of Cairo
Islamic Cairo Walking Tour: Khan el Khalili, Al-Azhar Mosque

reviews.title: Happening street in Cairo
reviews.text: Most happening street in Cairo. Best place to do shopping for best price. We will recommended to buy souvenirs, cloth. Spices and other items from this place. Evening and night little rush.

reviews.title: Fun to explore!
reviews.text: We didn’t buy much here but if you do definitely bargain. You can definitely get the items for 70% less than the original price. Especially if you come prepared with cash. We also explored the nearby local markets which had much cheaper pricing.

reviews.title: Eclectic
reviews.text:
This covers a big area I understand but we only saw a part of it. It's a wonderful warren of small alleys and shops, the most charming of which are the copperware and metal lantern shops which project a wonderful glow at night. There are a whole variety of shops for all tastes so you'll be sure to find a suitable souvenir here if that's what you're looking for.

Try the famous Khan Al-Khalili Restaurant if you want something to eat.

reviews.title: Khan Al khalili Market
reviews.text:
The market gives an old world charm, loads loads of things to buy trinkets, souvenirs, clothes, frankincense  etc but please please bargain for everything you buy or else you shall be looted. 
Do try the blueberry sherbet from the Syrian guy - it’s yummy

reviews.title: Perhaps go for a look see but not for buying
reviews.text: You can get all the items here elsewhere with a lot less hassle and cheaper. We bought a coffee cup set at Luxor airport gift shop and paid USD18. Yeah we thought you always overpay at such places. Then we saw the same set at el khalil and the vendor wanted USD60!! And here’s a big lol, at Cairo airport gift shop we saw the same set again and it was USD13. T-shirts and pants at el khalil were also not cheap compared to elsewhere. All in all, there’s not much reason to go other than the experience of it.

reviews.title: Perfect shopping day
reviews.text: Karim was an amazing tour guide,  he is very knowledgeable on the history of Egypt and knew the best places to shop! Caboo was an awesome driver and I felt very safe in his car!

reviews.title: Market like no other
reviews.text: There is a buzz in this place, you just have to witness and experience. Plenty of things to buy, taste, smell etc.

reviews.title: The bazaar at night... Incredible
reviews.text:
The bazaar by day is just Okay
At night, especially after 7 pm call to prayer, it comes to life.
Most of the tourists are gone and it's mostly locals 
The energy is incredible.
When in Cairo,plan a night visit

reviews.title: A challenging visit
reviews.text: Maybe we hit the bazaar at the wrong time of day (we went in the evening) but we were shocked at the amount of poverty surrounding this major tourist attraction. So many beggars and scam artists trying to sell to you and rip you off. The actual shop keepers themselves seemed fine, it’s just everyone else!

reviews.title: Interesting places
reviews.text: Get off the main streets and alleyways and explore the smaller shops, they have better prices and be prepared to haggle.

reviews.title: Best place to learn negotiating skills
reviews.text:
The oldest open air market in Cairo, Egypt.
Enjoy roaming the isles of this place, listen to  the stories of the past and breath the ancient culture.
Incredible to find yourself amongst the ancient history.

reviews.title: A must visit
reviews.text: Loved this market, touristy but not as much as other markets we have visited. Feels like you can get some good and not too tacky souvenirs.

reviews.title: Overwhelming and felt rather intimidating but we had the BEST turkish coffee at El Fishawy!
reviews.text: A huge bazaar with an amazing array of goods being sold.  Very crowded with people visiting as well as people selling.  I tried not to make too much eye contact because once you do that they follow you.  I found that the bazaars that we went to in Aswan (at the Nubian village)  and other smaller place were more approachable and easier to buy from.

reviews.title: Do once to do it
reviews.text: Totally a tourist trap.  Although there are some pretty decent restaurants that the locals go to in the evenings.  Go and take your required photo that the IG influencers made famous.  Thankfully we went with our private guide who took us through very quickly and kept vendors from hawking stuff at us.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: We had a tour guide take us through the bazar. He already mentioned it during the day that it is not much to see, but since every major tourist site recommended visiting Khan el Klalili we insisted on taking a look. It was not worth the 10 minutes we spent there. It is just about shopping, hustlers everywhere. I do not recommend it.

reviews.title: very big market - double prices
reviews.text: Nice to go around , to drink a coffee at a traditional cafe but dont buy anything from there too expensive or ask for over 60% discount on prices

reviews.title: A place you should visit
reviews.text:
Nice place, you should visit it ☺️
You can have great photos there and many gifts and antiques , in night be better

reviews.title: Touristic souvenirs at one location
reviews.text: Many small shops selling almost everything you might want to buy as a souvenir from Egypt. Do not forget to bargain and you will be surprised at the discount you are given. Even then be sure that their profit margin is still good.

reviews.title: Crazy place, no bargains.
reviews.text:
Worth the experience, but don't plan on finding any bargains unless you speak Arabic and look like a native Egyptian.  We noted that despite the craziness of the whole place, the one-on-one interactions between shopkeepers and customers is relatively calm.  

DO NOT take a white cab to or from the market, or anywhere else in Cairo for that matter.  Uber is the only way to go...trustworthy, cheap, and hassle-free.

reviews.title: Great place to shop in Cairo
reviews.text: Went here in October 2022. You have to make sure you stay within the tourist area of the market. We made the mistake of crossing over into the local part and got very lost for a long time! But the tourist part of the market is amazing. So much to see and buy. Would recommend visiting if you’re in Cairo and want to buy gifts for home. The market sellers can be quite pushy so be careful not to get too involved. But otherwise, great place to shop!

reviews.title: Good for people-watching
reviews.text: A huge market with tons of vendors.  Unfortunately most are selling just about the same (inexpensive) souvenirs.   There are some nice restaurants.   I spent just a few minutes looking around, then my guide and I had a nice lunch.

reviews.title: Cool place to wander around -
reviews.text: Very picturesque and interesting place. But as many other reviewers mentioned, the items for sale are not very authentic or unique. But fun place to wander about and many photo opportunities.   Did NOT find merchants to be too aggressive.

reviews.title: Must visited place at cairo with less expectations
reviews.text: It's not elegant compared to Istanbul grand Bazar, however you'll feel the old cairo street shop experience there. While buying products you have to have good bargain skills to get a good price . There will be few shops who will show negative energy while bargaining, but don't lose your stand anyway

reviews.title: Hustle and bustle
reviews.text:
Full of energy and great vibes. This place will energise you and shake you as well. Eager shop keepers, buskers, tight alleys, hanging lamps, souvenirs, restaurants, bars and what not. 
The market comes to life in the evening with locals and tourists pouring in. The vibe Carrie sim till late at night.

reviews.title: Overcrowded, dirty and overcharged!!!
reviews.text: Extremely disappointing. People back home raved about this place  but it is lacklustre. Traders try to swindle you all the time so you have to be sharp. It’s overcrowded with beggars everywhere.  We heard of the famous umm kulthum cafe in Khan Al Khalili. The waiter over charged us by 200 pounds and insisted on a tip of 55 pounds. What’s more is that while speaking to us he had seeds in his mouth and kept spitting the shells onto the floor. The other waiter was chewing gum when we walked in so he quickly took it and stuck it under one of the ornate tables.  After this experience my husband and I left this place completely and I don’t think we’ll be going back there.

reviews.title: Not even close in size to Istanbul bazaar
reviews.text: I thought it would be like Istanbul bazaar. Not even close. Not much variety of goods and a lot of low quality stuff. Hard to get to.

reviews.title: A must see!!
reviews.text: Very busy, very crowded but the old section is amazing. An essential part of a visit to Cairo. Lots of colour and great food in the old restaurants! Great coffee too!

reviews.title: Awful Place!
reviews.text:
Am absolute pit, wouldn't return here if I were paid, loafs of very rude people, if your a woman cover yourself from head to toe or dress as a man to divert attention, I was with my wife and the staring was just unbearable in the end.  Steer clear, it's only full of cheap looking junk anyway!

If your looking for something to do then book an excursion!

reviews.title: Not worth any effort
reviews.text: DO NOT GO. I don't know why this market is on the go to list in Cairo. Its a cheap market selling cheap junk. the worst is the behaviour of the shop keepets and other louts hanging around..they ogle the women and even try to molest them. Actually when the tourists give them their business and livelihood, its important that they learn to respect tourists, especially women in return. Its better if this place be boycotted !!!

reviews.title: An interesting local shopping experience
reviews.text: We visited this bazaar with a local guide. I'm very glad we did, as otherwise we would have gotten lost in the chaos. This is a good place to shop for local items, cheap trinkets, and gifts to take back home. You can find local food, spices, cotton products, lamps/lanterns, clothing, jewelry, incense etc. To me as a westerner, I found the market to be very exotic. I was expecting Alladin to pop out from just around the corner!  The place was busy mostly with locals. I enjoyed the sights, and the smell of incense. I did not like the constant hassle from shop keepers to check out their products. One shopkeeper literally asked me "how can I take your money? " They are more than happy to rip you off. If you'd like to purchase something you must haggle. Otherwise you will be greatly overcharged. This is one of the things that I hate about Egypt. Nothing ever has a clearly marked price. Locals pay one price, and tourists another as they are constantly charged way more. We are walking bank machines! If you don't like the price of something, simply walk away. If the vendor is desperate enough he will sell you the item at the price you're willing to pay as he doesn't want to miss out on the sale. Have fun shopping and haggling, but be safe as well. Watch out for pickpockets. I recommend for women to carry a crossbody bag in front of you that is slash resistant. I use Travelon's bags, they are great. You will need cash for the market. If you want to bring your credit cards with you, make sure you have a RFD blocking wallet/money belt/purse pocket. As a blond petite woman, I would never go to this market by myself. You will be not only constantly harassed but ogled, and in some cases followed or groped. Try to avoid this by dressing modestly and going to the market with a companion or a guide.

reviews.title: Blend with the locals
reviews.text: Spent a few hours walking the streets and intrigued by the shops selling almost everything. Very busy and amazing to see locals shopping.

reviews.title: Only if seller stop chasing buyer.
reviews.text:
I like going to night market/ bazaar, but this market is sitting at the bottom of my list, because no one will let you walk in peace keep harassing you aside from the price they set for you to haggle. Stuff sold there mostly similar to the Grand Bazaar in Istanbul, where price is cheaper with no harassment. 

going out of the market to main road is a pain, we had to ask for tourist police help and fortunately we met a nice tourist police who walked us to the main road for us to catch cab back to hotel, without asking for cash/ tips. 

getting cab there is another story, even getting one with Uber when arrived the driver will cancel your order and ask for more fare. 

Tips: Ignore everyone asking you questions, do not let them have a change to start conversation, no eye contact.

reviews.title: Great place to buy stuff for you and your family and friends
reviews.text: Definitely a crazy place I would say but not difficult to get around and shop. Don’t bother buying stuff  at the tourist attractions in Egypt go here and walk around, remember you can look without buying it just takes a lot of will power, however don’t talk pictures unless you are prepared to tip the store attendant. I shopped here and it was definitely good value for money and also remember to brush up on your negotiating skills because it’s a must at most places some people will have a flat price and they will not negotiate but in those cases it’s mostly reasonable so don’t worry too much.

reviews.title: A must see thing in Cairo.!!!!
reviews.text: It is a totally must thing to see. The vibes and the atmosphere is so authentic. I wish I could buy and carry with me back in the USA all the stuff they sell there.

reviews.title: Horrible place
reviews.text:
Horrible place
Constant harrassment from shop keepers
Prices are inflated x 5 
Terrible quality of goods

Tourist police should not allow tourist in the area lots of scammers

reviews.title: Dirtyland
reviews.text: Poop, pee and flies everywhere. Sanitary conditions are terrible. Everyone haunt you and don’t let you look in calm. Just go if you like being stalked and getting rotten smell sensations.

reviews.title: Not worth the time
reviews.text: Not worth your time with all that Cairo has to offer.  A junky souvenir market with overly aggressive sellers. You don’t want to look at anything because the seller will pounce on you. The market in Aswan has higher quality goods, easier conversations with sellers and seems to be used by local people. I am not sure why our tour company Overseas Adventure Travel includes this in the itinerary.

reviews.title: Don’t Go
reviews.text: Overpriced , too many people hassling us both in shops and on the street . Merchandise  was mainly made in China , nothing authentic , does not compare to the markets we visited in Morocco and Turkey

reviews.title: Bustling market
reviews.text:
Enter near the AL Azhar mosque entrance. Only worth going along to the middle cross junction area. Beware of pushy sellers. Don't be fooled by converted prices. 
Difficult to arrange an Uber taxi from here. 
Plenty of choice. Buy all souvenirs here.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: A great bazaar selling everything….really beautiful jewellery to table clothes to spices to tourist stuff ..want to go back….not pushy at all…just say no thanks…! People just want you to go and look at their shop/goods etc because it’s a little part of them…totally fine when you say thanks for sharing and go…in a trifle beautiful part of Cairo too….feel very humbled really.

reviews.title: Entertaining
reviews.text:
Visited as part of a UK small group tour as a brief stop .There was work going on to get major works finished on the large mosque so it was chaos! Walked through the narrow bazaar streets full of vendors selling shiny things,sparkly things and the inevitable T shirts!(Probably all imported) All a fun experience.
Sat with a cool fresh lemon and mint to watch the workmen ,the crane and the little dumper trucks trying to negotate past the crowds.The big bus getting stuck was good entertainment.

reviews.title: Must see beautiful vibrant market open 24h
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. This is a local market open 24h. You can buy anything from beautiful chandeliers to oils, clothes, souvenirs. Most of the things need to be negotiated and there are a few annoying sellers trying to push you to buy. The market is a must visit though.

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.text: This for me was one of the worse bazaars I have been to on my travels in the Middle East and Africa.  It has a great atmosphere which is the only positive, especially at night.  Other than that, it is dirty, vendors sell a whole heap of junk and be prepared especially if you are a woman to get hounded!  I couldn't wait to get out.

reviews.title: Huge and lively market
reviews.text:
We came to Khan Al-Khalili wanting to wander around, buy some souvenirs and eat some simple food. Right of the bat, an elegant guy approached us claiming his name is Ali and that he's a lawyer and he could show us the way to the market that we are searching for. He said that he's not a tour guide and he just wants to practice his English.
It ended like 2 hours later, we barely got out of it, he asked for money in the end, stating "if you liked my tour, you should give me something". I was obviously annoyed with him lying from the beginning so we didn't give him any money. He took us to some places which we would not see without him, so that was good. We bought some spices from his companion and ate at a good restaurant he recommended, so I guess he will get a percentage out of it. 
In the end, it was a useful experience, but if you don't like being lied to or would like some privacy (like we did after an hour), keep an eye out for these kinds of people.
The market is huge, hectic, lively, cheerful, we loved it!

reviews.title: Easier with a guide
reviews.text:
If you have few days in Cairo worth spending 3-4 hours here. So many exotic items on display and several nice things to view. Be prepared to haggle as prices are different for tourists
We went with a knowledgeable tour guide who helped us to make sure we are not pushed into buying in any shop if we did not like items or price
It could be part of few day trips through EMO tours and worth combining so that you have your guide helping you.

reviews.title: INTERESTING BAZAAR
reviews.text: I came here to sightsee, not to buy anything. There were food vendors here, and craft merchants. Tourists too, some of which were taking pictures. Others were haggling with the merchants over prices of souvenirs. I heard German  English, and French spoken.

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text: I don’t recommend coming here. The place is hectic, although the people are very nice. If you want to get cheaper souvenirs buy from the people at the Pyramids of Giza rather than here. Thankfully I already bought the souvenirs  at the Pyramids which are much cheaper. I got 100 LE for 20 pouches. You can’t get a deal like that at this market.

reviews.title: Not to be missed, and not only for shopping!
reviews.text: Great experience, strolling through the small streets, looking, negotiating and buying at the shops, enjoying great rice cream, and this in a friendly (not too pushy at all!!!) environment.

reviews.title: A great place to but souvenirs.
reviews.text: Khan el Khalili bazaar is fun to  browse vibrant displays of fabrics, handicrafts, and antiques. This was a much more enjoyable experience and while we have become much more used to how aggressive some of the shop owners and vendors can be, this was certainly much more reasonable than the assaults we have gotten at some of the other market places. My wife bought herself a hieroglyphic T-shirt that matches mine that she purchased in the Egyptian museum store. I also picked up a couple of shot glasses

reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.text:
What a great souk! We visited with our guide through a side entrance through the automotive section. The shopkeepers engaged in friendly batter and seemed genuinely pleased with my limited Arabic. We purchased some jewelry as a gift and a gorgeous cane made with ebony, lapis lazuli and malachite for less than a hundred dollars.
A stop into a coffee shop for hot chocolate while the henna tattoos dried capped the day.

name: Nile River

photo.caption: Sunset by the Nile river, Cairo, Egypt.

ranking_subcategory: #22 of 288 things to do in Cairo
subcategory_ranking: #22 of 288 things to do in Cairo
ranking: #22 of 288 things to do in Cairo
description: Stretching for 4,187 miles, the longest river in the world flows from its major source, Lake Victoria in east central Africa, through Uganda, Sudan, Ethiopia and northwards into Egypt to the Mediterranean Sea.

offer_list.title: 1-Hour Private Felucca Cruise on the Nile River with traditional food
Felucca Sailing trip on the Nile in Cairo
Short Felucca Trip On The Nile In Cairo
Nile Cruise Holiday from Luxor to Aswan 4 Nights 5 Days
2-Hour Felucca Ride on the River Nile from Cairo - Sunset or Sunrise Options

reviews.title: Nile River cruise dinner
reviews.text: Longest River in Africa and 2nd longest River in the world. We had fantastic Nile cruise river dinner in Cairo which operated by Andrea. It was 5 stars 2 hours dinner cruise with lots of fun and yummy foods.

reviews.title: Pleasent Cruise with fantastic service
reviews.text:
We really enjoyed our 3 day cruise from Aswan to Luxor booked for us by the very knowledgable Egyptologist Essam from EgyptBestVacations tour operator.  From the general manager to every staff member there was a noteworthy effort made to ensure each guest got the best of service. The food was very good quality with plenty of choice for all nationalities. The different creations with towels and cushions left on our bed by Marco gave us a daily laugh. Abdul our waiter was genuine and a joy  to be served by while Abdul and his deputy along with the chefs kept on top of everything The cabin had everything but was tight and there were plenty of areas to relax especially the top deck. 
As other reviews note because of the ships docking alongside cabin and dining room curtains are often kept closed with no view of the river which one would expect on a cruise and is disappoonting . 
The encouragement of some guests of the boat traders with their constant screaming mars the full pleasure of cruisng down the Nile.

reviews.title: Dated depressing decor
reviews.text: We travelled on the presidential odessy , the boat itself was very dated and needs a full refurbishment, staff were lovely apart fron reception who were not very helpful. Alot of us came down with diarrhea, the cabins were small and depressing we couldn't open the curtains for the flies. The excursions were good but very hectic had to be up at crack of dawn .we were asked for a £27pp tip for crew as soon as we got on !!! Would I go on this boat again definitely NOT.

reviews.title: Ripped off with bar bill
reviews.text:
I would have given the MS Mojito 4 stars were it not for the fact that we were ripped off with our bar bill.
The boat is very smart, clean and comfortable, the cabins modern and up to date, beds very comfortable. Food was very good all week and staff absolutely lovely, all very helpful.
HOWEVER the system for paying for drinks is a scam, each time you order anything you have to sign a duplicate sheet with your name and cabin number. What should happen is that you are then given a copy so you can keep a record of what you have spent, however no-one was ever given a copy. When we came to pay our bill at the end of the week there were things on there we had not ordered, such as additional bottles of wine and beers. As we had no evidence we didn't have a leg to stand on and just had to pay.
Also if you chose to pay in GBP, they gave an exchange rate of only 23 Egyptian pounds to the pound sterling when the bank rate was 36. I chose to pay on my card in Egyptian pounds but was than charged 4% extra, still better than being hammered with the ridiculous exchange rate. 
People we knew were on a different boat and they were given all their bar receipts, be warned this does not happen on the Mojito!

reviews.title: Amazing nile cruise
reviews.text:
Excellent experience.....our ship was TiYi 2 .....which wasn't the best, but still very enjoyable.  Food was amazing. 
At each port of call we saw fabulous temples etc.  It's amazing to see hundreds of boats tied together at the ports....you have to walk through various boats to get to shore.  Fabulous seeing sun rise and sunset over the nile ....highly recommended way of moving around

reviews.title: Wonderful Nile Cruise
reviews.text:
We travelled with Orbital Travel on a 3  night stay in Cairo and then 7 nights cruising the Nile. What a  great job Orbital did!  The reps  were able to take away any  concerns/stress as they were easy to find when we arrived and saw us through all the steps needed at immigration , baggage collection, transfer to the hotel, check in and registration.  The guides they provided for the excursions were knowledgeable and great fun. Well done  Hussan and Marco. Mena House was comfortable and had amazing views of the pyramids. The Royal Esadora was a great ship to enjoy the Nile cruise.ALL the staff did a great job to make us comfortable and well looked after.
Orbital organised everything  brilliantly, even the early wake up calls! The whole trip went smoothly and was an amazing experience. We can't thank Orbital and their representatives enough and will recommend them to anyone wanting to go on this cruise.

reviews.title: Nile cruise MS Royal Esadora
reviews.text:
MS Royal Esadora, Orbital travel
Just returned (Feb 2023) from an 8 day Nile cruise organised via Classic Holidays. 
Having travelled for many years independently we were a little concerned as to how the process would work, from transfers, the boat, temple visits, eating times etc.
We should not have worried. Everything worked like a well-oiled machine. Transfers were fine, boat accommodation was better than expected, cabins were comfortable and very clean. Food was plentiful with a good selection for all tastes.
Trips were the highlight; we had 2 Egyptologist’s with us, who split us into 2 small groups. They were both very knowledgeable and had a really good command of English, and the groups small enough to allow everyone to hear the commentary and allow questions from all. The schedule is quite punishing however with many very early starts, but in our view a price well worth paying for all the sights on offer.
The only slightly disappointing trip was the Philae light show, the light show itself needs updating.
Overall an unbelievable experience and we would fully recommend Classic Holidays.

reviews.title: SS Sudan - Save your money
reviews.text:
We were very much looking forward to our cruise on the SS Sudan, the early 20th century paddle wheeler where Agatha Christie wrote a portion of "Death on the Nile".  The boat is owned and operated by a French tour company, a fact not disclosed in the marketing materials directed at English speakers.  The Egyptian crew struggled with English.  The boat itself is nice enough and reasonably maintained.  However, the food is atrocious for a cruise priced at 800 Euro per person per day.  The same small Continental breakfast buffet was served each day.   The same soup was re-invented an re-cycled each day over a five day cruise.  The entrees ranged from mediocre to inedible.  Left overs were sometimes dressed up and re-served.  The internet, even in the lounge area, is virtually non-existent.  Don't plan on streaming anything while aboard, and you cannot rely on vessel's wi-fi for your phone service.  If you do succeed in accessing the internet, you will be randomly kicked off after a few minutes.  The general manager was absent from the vessel for the first four nights of the cruise, and it was obvious the crew took advantage of his absence by not attending to details such as lighting the candles in the common areas.  A nice touch was the flowers delivered on the first day of the cruise; however, they were already dead and were wilted by the third day.  The upper sun deck is lovely, but only has nine lounge chairs for a vessel that carries 40 plus passengers.  The same passengers staked out the chairs every day but the last.  The ship does have a bar as advertised, but it is not well-stocked.  Order a cocktail at your peril - it will be something very different from what you expect.  

Complaints were either ignored or glossed over by supervisory personnel.  When I was finally able to speak to the general manager on the last day of the cruise, he acknowledged that he was aware of the issues with food and internet connectivity.  He gave me no indication that these issues were being addressed.

The cruise was particularly disappointing because the land portions of our trip both before, after and while aboard SUDAN in Egypt were first class.  We had no complaints about our day trips from the boat and the guide provided while on the cruise.  Food quality and internet access were not issues at the hotels we stayed at before and after the cruise.  Most tellingly, the food in coach on Egypt Air and Turkish Air on the flight home.

This could have been so much better with minimal effort and less corner cutting.

reviews.title: Adventure, Knowledge, Magic and Wonder
reviews.text: Feb 2023 and a wonderful Nile Cruise with Orbital on the Esadora. The boat is great value for money, staff are friendly and helpful, food was great, my vegan family members managed better than they thought and the cabins were clean and comfortable. Really though, it was the guides that hold these kind of holidays together. They handle all the excursions, any problems we experienced and what is lost in translation, they sort out. Adel Alfons was our guide and for Abu Simbel, Mohamed Emam. Both were excellent, helpful, knowledgeable and Adel went out of his way to ensure everyone fulfilled their expectations. I feel incredibly grateful and lucky to have had such wonderful hosts in such a magnificent and magical journey.

reviews.title: Sunrise M/S Semiramis III cruise ship review
reviews.text:
We booked this ship as a five-stars deluxe, but it turned out to be as a 3 stars. I did not compare this ship with others, but from what I heard, it is considered as one of  a good standards ships in Egypt (!!).
The rooms are small and this is expected, the mattress is comfortable, it has tea & coffee set, we were not able to turn on the AC to heat (only cooling). Connected rooms are available.
Three meals are included, not variable, not tasty but somewhat satisfactory. Water and drinks are not included, you have to pay for them.
The pool at the deck is small, it was cold out there so we were not able to use it. 
The program included evening entertainment (2-3 shows), but this was not true, nothing was provided at the three evenings we spent on the ship.
As we asked for the WIFI, the first answer was that it is not free, when we faced them with what they claimed on their website they provided us with complementary  1 GB WIFI during our stay, it was weak at the room but good at the restaurant and the lounge bar. 
Check out is at 8 am (too early) our guide was to pick us at 12 pm, they only allowed us to delay check out to 9 am.
If there will be a next time I will look for another cruise ship even if it costs more.

reviews.title: No no no to MS Semiramis 111, go at your peril
reviews.text:
MS Semiramis 111, nit 5* as I was sold, 3.5 according to Expedia. Egypt Escapes get their packages from you travel.com. . Font waste your time find a reputable company for your cruise, food iffy, scruffy cabins. Package says ultra all inclusive, then they tell you we'll that's really all inclusive. Waste of money fortunately the hotel stay was good,  it needed to be for £3500. You can pay a low price for the same as what we got.
It's moored in Luxor out of town so there is nowhere to go. Give Egypt Escapes a miss along with Sunrise cruises.
Never again

reviews.title: Egypt! Finally, the top of my bucket list!
reviews.text:
Egypt is a fabulous mix of ancient and new with approximately 26 million people in the Cairo region. Traffic is exciting, to say the least, and drivers communicate by honking. Whatever you do, hire a driver anywhere near Cairo! A large number of people are multilingual and Egypt is much more cosmopolitan than you might expect. The food is wonderful and the cultural and historic sites are outstanding. Can’t wait to return when the GEM opens. 
If you can, take time to cruise down the Nile. It is worth every penny and minute. From Cairo to Luxor to Aswan, there is so much to see and it is so lovely to be on the river. 
Egyptians are kind and helpful and generous - truly wonderful hosts and guides and so rightfully proud of their country and heritage! 
Just respect them as you would wish to be respected and you are in for a real treat.

reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.text: We Did 7 nite Cruise all Facitilles are very Good Food/Cabins and Staff cant do Enough for you, Just for your info make sure that you are All in clusive lot thought they were but were not Happy and Wifi is Very Poor only at Reception is Hit and Miss

reviews.title: MS Acamar Nile cruise
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the MS Acamar. Our cruise was from Luxor to Aswan and back. The food was very good, our son needed gluten free food which was no problem. The whole ship is an a good shape and very clean. The crew members were very nice and made the trip very comfortable.

reviews.title: Cruise from hell
reviews.text:
Clean the bathrooms and remove the black mould and dirt from floors...
Ensure food is hot..
Ensure muster Station drill is performed

reviews.title: Semiramis 1 Nile Cruise l
reviews.text:
The ship allows smoking in the corridors and inside the rooms. This exposed my children to second-hand smoking.
I spoke to the staff several times, and they agreed that indoor smoking is against Egyptian law ; however,  they didn't do anything about it.
There are ashtrays everywhere. I complained to the staff that by putting ashtrays,  they indirectly approve indoor smoking. 
I strongly warn families from going to this cruise ship.

reviews.title: Terrible ship
reviews.text:
The ship is very old. The carpets are full if stains. The whole ship smells of cigarettes smoke. Guests are allowed to smoke indoors which cause the whole ship to smell.
The food quality is acceptable but bot special.
Tea,  Coffee and even water is not provided but is provided for an additional cost.
I would rate this ship at 2.5 or maximum 3 stars.

reviews.title: Movenpick Royal Lily Cruise
reviews.text: We recently returned from our Nile cruise with Royal Lily Movenpick. We had an amazing time having paid for an upgrade on board to a suite. The stops from Luxor to Aswan were excellent and Mustafa the head guide was brilliant. The service on board was exceptional - nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed our Stella beers and Aida sparkling local wine on the beautiful and spacious upper sum deck. Passengers included families from Lebanon, Egypt, India, USA, Canada, France and the UK. There was an excellent whirling dervish and belly dancing show. Food on board, although a buffet, was always delicious and varied. Breakfast was always excellent. The lounge bar is rather tired and in need of an upgrade and don't expect much entertainment. Early mornings are the norm for the great excursions to Karnak and Luxor temples, Kom Ombo, Edfu and Philae Temple in beautiful Aswan. A very relaxing cruise. Thanks to all the staff for such a memorable trip.

reviews.title: Uniworld Egypt Tip
reviews.text:
Uniworld trip to Egypt staying at the Four Seasons Hotel in Cairo and a weeks sailing  trip on the SS Sphinx ship.  Fantastic hotel from the rooms, staff, decor and for food.  SS Sphinx ship is well decorated, rooms comfortable, staff very helpful and friendly and attentive, food excellent.
Excursions were well worth it despite the early get-ups which make sense to avoid the crowds and the mid-day heat.  Our Egyptologist Mohamed Shehata was very knowledge, very friendly and made the excursions enjoyable.
Negatives were the disappointing Afternoon Tea at The Old Cataract Hotel which I was particularly looking forward to.  We were led through the hotel and straight out onto a outside terrace so hardly had chance to take a look at the decor of the inside of the hotel.  The Afternoon Tea was very disappointing.  We had 1 tea bag per person, no teapot and had to ask for milk.  We served ourselves and even had to remove the cellophane from the cake stands which was a bit fiddly. and then the sandwiches were very dry.  Obviously been made a lot earlier on in the day.  The tablecloths had a layer of sand over them as it was a breezy day.  I was expecting a dining experience inside the atmosphere of the hotel, we could have been anyway on that terrace.  
We did not receive an evening meal on the first 2 nights of our stay in the Four Seasons Hotel, nor the last evening or the last lunch time of our stay which we would have expected for the cost of the holiday.  We could have at least been offered a light meal on our arrival and departure which would have been appreciated due to the travelling time we endured.
Overall a great experience though had by us.

reviews.title: Stay away from the Royal Ruby cruise ship
reviews.text:
The only royal thing about this ship is it’s name! Barely a 3 star place accommodations and they advertise it as 5. This is by the war the worst experience ever. From horrendous food to stinky rooms this boat doesnt stop to disappoint ! We paid 10000 LE per person , and had to eat out for every single meal. The triple room ended up with a double bed and a metal cot!! This is just terrible! Stay away at all cost. This place ruined our longed for vacation to the beautiful Luxor and Aswan. 
Book a hotel!

reviews.title: Blue shadow Nile cruise from aswan to luxor a little disappointing
reviews.text:
We were told to board by 12pm on day 1 in Aswan and then didn't sail till 2 pm on day 2. What's the great idea of sitting on the boat docked next to another in Aswan. There's no view.
The rooms were comfortable and clean, although there was no kettle for tea coffee as advertised. Neither were there any welcome drinks or refreshing towels offered on boarding.
The upper deck had a clean pool and covered seating area. The boat looks quite grand with a staircase and shops and massage parlor and lounge bar.
Loved the view of the banks of the Nile as we set sail.
The food buffets were average. Staff polite. The shocking part was my daughter got sick, a tummy bug after eating on the ship and there was no doctor on call. We had to pay the earth to get a doctor to come see her in Luxor so that she could be administerd to in order to fly back to Cairo. How can such a big boat which caters to so many elderly tourists not have a doctor on board.  It is shameful and highly distressing.

reviews.title: Avoid booking with Discover Egypt!
reviews.text:
Avoid booking with Discover Egypt!!! I’m currently on the Nile Cruise and really disappointed with the customer service they have provided (nothing wrong with the boat staff, just the booking agency!). 
There are 25 out of 125 cabins occupied and I complained about my single cabin (really small and it’s at the front of the boat so it’s very noisy). Considering it would cost them nothing to move me to a standard cabin, they didn’t! I would understand if the boat was full but there are SO many empty cabins that they could move me to but won’t. 
There are so many booking agencies you can book a nile cruise with - Audley Travel, Egypt Tours Portal. So if you want to book with a company that actually cares about your holiday then DO NOT BOOK with DISCOVER EGYPT!!!

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text:
My Mum and I had a Wonderful experience on our Nile cruise MS Esadora. It was clean and good food with no upset tummies. The staff were polite and helpful, Our Egyptologist Aymen was fantastic. So knowledgeable , funny and kind. 
We had a fantastic group of people on the boat with us.
The trips were amazing and well worth a visit. Definitely would recommend a Nile cruise.

reviews.title: Ms renaissance cruise boat
reviews.text: I would never do a Nile cruise again,,the rooms are gloomy and dated,the food is really not the best ,the boat moored up for thee nights in Aswan right next door to the large tip ,,,,the flys were unbelievable,,,,trying to sunbath was an absolute nightmare for everyone,,,,, cheapest mooring,,,,,,,most of the staff were very hard working and friendly,,,some reception staff were a bit standoffish,,,if you don’t buy the drinks package then you won’t be buying a drink,£15 for a Bacardi and coke,,,,a lot of us were up really early to go on the trips so you really couldn’t have to many drinks,so the package wasn’t worth it ,,so either way you was snookered,,the bar was always dead ,no atmosphere, the pollution on the Nile is absolutely horrendous,,it’s just so smoggy when all the boats are cruising,, also being told to pay £35 each for tips ,at the end of the cruise,,,no thanks,I’ll tip the ones that deserve it ,,,, everywhere you went was hard work,,they just want money,,the actual trips to the wonders are really amazing,we got our own guide {ms renaissance did not like that }they treated our guild really badly,they would not let us know that he had arrived to pick us up,,,they wanted us to buy the trips from them ,,,,unbelievable,I’ve never done a review before but just thought I would put it out there to save anyone from a poo experience on the ms renaissance ,,, there are no balconies just a bottom sliding window and some of the rooms are over the engine rooms and are very very noisy,,they had to move us in the the because we couldn’t sleep 😴

reviews.title: Nile cruise
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the 7 days Nile cruise .this a 5 star experience .highly recommend you to do the Nile cruise.very friendly crew.

reviews.title: Beautiful, clean and lots of different tours available
reviews.text: The Nile River is really a sight to see. It's long and has different characters depending where it meets. The big city Cairo has it's tour cruises. At Aswan the Nile gives you chances to see less populated cites and is mostly set along the sandy desert. For the most part the Nile is still clean and gives some great breezes against the Egyptian heat.

reviews.title: Cairo & MS Royal Viking cruise with Mercury Holidays
reviews.text:
Pick-up by Mercury Holiday Rep at airport.  Not very organised and was very slow getting out of airport.  Equally slow getting our rooms allocated once we got to the Rameses hilton.  Several of our group went to reception as Rep not being very proactive.  Hotel comfortable.  Drinking water provided in the room.  Beds very comfortable.  Breakfast and dinner provided and were good choice and quality.
Started with 1 full day in Cairo with our group and a guide.  Pyramids, Cairo museum, papyrus shop & essential oil shop.  Pyramids very interesting and guide very knowledgable.  Option to do walk into the burial chamber of largest pyramid, (440 egyptian £).  Interesting but is basically a very narrow, cramped, congested corridor with steep up and down sections into the pyramid.  Had to walk some sections with legs and back bent as unable to stand.  Chamber at end contains stone sarcophagus but nothing else, and no art work to see.  
Could have done without the shops as meant not enough time to properly explore the museum, but I guess this is a feature of most package tours. Lunch was provided and less time could have been allocated to this, but again a feature of group travel.
Next day was our early flight to Luxor.  Definitely better to have the early flight, even though it meant a 4.30am wake up.  Had the afternoon to relax on boat in Luxor.
MS Royal Viking  a comfortable boat, although all the dark wood makes it feel dated. 
 We had requested a room with double bed when we booked.  Definitely worth doing this as majority of rooms have twin beds. Big windows but only able to open the curtains when boat is sailing, at which time we were more likely to be up on the sun deck.  The way the boats moor at various points next to each other means there is cm between your window and the window of the boat next door, so not privacy if curtains open.
Meals all included on cruise.  At best the food was very average, and some dishes below this.  Egyptian vegetable dishes were quite tasty, but everything else was basically all very similar taste.  The food was arranged as a buffet and many times it was barely warm, even when we were there at start of the meal time.  I would not have rated the food 5*, (which the Royal Viking says it is rated).
The omlettes freshly cooked for you at breakfast were good.
No drinks were included, and we would have considered to have drinking water available on the table at meal times, and tea and coffee available at other times should be standard.  Particularly as we were told the tap water on board was not suitable for drinking, and we should use bottled water for teeth brushing.  Tea/ coffee was available at breakfast but other times needed to be paid for.  Several members of our group had packed their own electric kettle, after previous experience of this type of holiday, and I would do this is future.
We elected to not pay the additional payment to upgrade to all inclusive  drinks.  This was the right decision.  You would have to be a big drinker to get your money's worth.  We had bought a bottle duty free gin before leaving.  So only paid for the tonic on board.  There is a small fridge in the room.  
Our guide for the week was very knowledgeable, and always happy to answer questions.  At some sites it would have been nice to have more time to explore on our own.  To explore more in Luxor would have been great but unfortunately Royal Viking has a mooring a long way from the city, although other companies do moor their boats in the city centre.
Optional trips - We only elected to pay extra for the Abu Simbel trip, and the Karnak temple sound and light show.  Abu Simbel was a very early start and long drive but worth doing for us.  Did notice though that the fact the temple had been dismantled and relocated wasn't mentioned prior to our arrival at the site. This may have changed some people's minds about paying the £100 (GBP) each.
The sound and light show at Karnak temple was a waste of money.  Interesting commentary but the light show aspect was very underwhelming.  Save your money on this one.
Wifi needed to be paid extra for, and only available in the lounge bar and reception area.  Not in cabins.  TV reception very staticy and only 1 english speaking channel, but we didn't watch alot anyway.
Sundeck area very comfortable and no problem getting a comfortable sunbed.  We didn't use the small pool but was told it was cold.

reviews.title: Terrible service
reviews.text:
Review for Surise semimaris II

On 17.11.2022, tour booked from luxor to Aswan . 

One of the worst experiences,  I have with Tourist/Hotel / company working in hospitality field. The cruise employee at reception treated / talked to me like that they are doing some favour to me, never smile, always have serious look at there face

I get in ship at 10:40 at Reception:

They told me my room would        
      be ready within 30 minutes. 
After 4th times 30 mins wait each time
 , At  13:10   they gave me a  room , which is in the basement with old bed sheets , torn up bed walls, no chairs and window  started from my shoulder heights.

I decided to leave the ship and cancel the trip with them . Then they asked me to give a one chance , and after 1 hour of morewaiting i got a room in 2nd floor. All settle good, room was alrught , and I went for luxor tour. 

when I came back and open the room ,  there is someone else in my room .   

They change my room and LUGGAGE WITHOUT ASKING ME  OR HAVING MY PERMISSION. 

I dont know where THEY put my luggage.  

The reason they gave me , they ask my tour agent to change,  which was a  blank LIE.  even if they ask my tour agent  , how dare they touch my bags  without my permission.

They ruined my whole day and holiday start , without apologizing a single time. I left the cruise to settle on another one

reviews.title: A big thumbs up for Galal
reviews.text:
Just finished a 7 day Nile cruise.
We booked all the excursion packages available in the overall holiday booking and added those only available through the tour guide. All of these were provided by Meeting Point.
We are exhausted! Exhausted but very glad for every part of every day.
There were a number of early morning alarm calls to start the day, with early breakfast and departures. A fair amount of travel by coach, and a good bit of walking. 
We would not have missed any part of it.
We visited Luxor, Karnak, Valley of the Kings, Temple of Queen Hatshepsut,, Colossi of Memnon, Kom Ombo Temple, Aswan Dams, Philae Temple, Nubian Experience, Esna Temple, and Abu Simnel, also sailed the Nile in motorised and sailing boats.
Every moment of every excursion was made entertaining and educational thanks to our Tour Manger and Egyptologist - Galal Hassan Marghany; he is not just knowledgable, he has a friendly and humourous delivery, is happy to take questions and means it when he refers to the tour group as 'family'

reviews.title: Brilliant 7 days.
reviews.text: We had a 7 day cruise on the Royal Esadora & thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was a great size n bed was very comfy. Every day we came back to a different creature made out of towels. Everywhere was kept very clean n tidy. All staff were friendly n polite. Ahmed from Orbital travel was our tour guide n he was just brilliant, full of knowledge n fun. The food was plentiful n of decent quality, abit samey but not a problem. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: MS Royal Esadora Nile cruise arranged by Classic Holidays
reviews.text:
We travelled for 7 nights aboard the MS Royal Esadora.  This boat is rated as 5 stars by the Egyptian travel authorities.  It is not 5 star by British ratings - however - they get a lot of things spot on.  
The staff are superb, all of them well trained to do their jobs, all of them friendly, all of them effective in their work, all of them willing to assist.  This is a very good starting point for the review.  The food comes next, it's varied and plentiful.  Food is something of a matter of individual taste but I found there to be something for everyone most, if not all of the time.  It was well prepared and well cooked.  To complement the food is the drink, (we opted for the £150 per person all inclusive package) the wine is drinkable, served by the glass at mealtimes.  I preferred the red to the white but it is Egyptian wine not AOC from a better region of France if you follow my meaning!  Water was plentiful and so was Stella beer and Sprite.  Spirits were 'interesting, the gin as OK, the brandy a little tasteless and the whisky has a definite flavour of vanilla!  Folk quickly got used to the different taste of local spirits! The bedrooms now are, as might be expected, smaller than you would find in a city 5 star hotel.  Having said that they are perfectly adequate with enough space to do everything that needs to be done.  Handy sockets for charging phones (with an adapter) and a TV which we didn't use.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom, whilst bijou, was again perfectly adequate.  The room was kept immaculate by the housekeeping team who dressed the room each day with a sculpture made from towels.  The public areas of the boat were always clean and tidy, again with staff always willing to help.  The Restaurant and bar staff were helpful, and friendly and always keen to please.  There were sufficient sun beds and tables and chairs on the upper deck and the small on deck pool was well used but never crowded.  The evening entertainment was a bit hit and miss, again, individual taste come in play here.  My personal favourite was the Whirling Dervish.  There were two 'Egyptian Evenings' on board where the adventurous dress in 'traditional; costume.  This can be purchased on board or in any local bazar.  We opted of buying some clothing on the boat and were not disappointed with the costumes which was sufficient for both of us for a total of around £35 sterling.  In addition to the clothing there was offers of help to tie headscarves correctly and even apply makeup!  Two of our party used the spa services for a massage and both commented how good it was, the head neck and back massage cost in the region of £35 sterling.
The tour guide we were allocated, Ahmed, was excellent, there's nothing more to add to that really.  Good knowledge and care taken with less abled tourists.  He bought the Nile experience to life.  The different tours I don't intend to comment on other than to say that the opportunity to see the sights, many of which have been around for over three thousand years is truly awesome.  Beware the pony and trap drivers, they do like to spice things up with a bit of a race!  Ours badly mishandled things and very nearly turned the trap over - not a good experience - he then proceeded to try and diddle us on the agreed price.  A note about tipping - everyone works hard to get tips, some don't work so hard but still feel entitled, some just ask for money!  This is constant everywhere in Egypt and it is a bit like their selling techniques (and 'upselling' techniques) must start in the cradle - they are very good at it.  Just about everything you buy you need to barter for, they are used to it, we are not which always gives them the upper hand.  If yo don't want to buy, don't make eye contact, and walk on by with a firm 'No Thankyou' if necessary.
Back to the ME Royal Esadora, we had a great time, and the old adage applies would I go back on board, yes, I would.  The package that we had from Classic Holidays was very competitively priced and it worked well for our group.  Would I use them again, yes I would.  Why only four stars, I believe that there is always room for improvement albeit small improvements.

reviews.title: Graceful skyline - pretty sunrises
reviews.text: stayed at the Fairmont Nile Hotel and was upgraded to a full Nile view room.  Saw the sunrise over teh Nile and teh boats and river traffic floating by.  Very relaxing!

reviews.title: Worth a Look
reviews.text: Certainly recommend you see the river and perhaps take a cruise. It is such a part of the history of Egypt. However, the waterfront is not very picturesque.

reviews.title: Royal Viking Nile Cruise
reviews.text:
We were on the Royal Viking Nile Cruise for 4 nights as part of a group tour from Sri Lanka. 

The room and amenities were good. The toilet smelled of stagnant water. A leak was promptly attended to by the maintenance team. 

Bed linen was changed everyday, which is unnecessary - if you need to cut costs. 

Water on the cruise is supposedly pricy so our guide advised us to take our own bottled water. WiFi had to be paid for and was available at the reception and lounge. It would have been appreciated if water and WiFi was provided without charging exorbitant prices, specially "Water is a valuable resource in both life and in the ways of Islam, and as such, it is considered a great charitable act in Islam to give water to another living thing on earth. Such act is greatly rewarded and brings us closer to Allah".

The food was tasteless, reparative and lacked flavour. Eg. The pasta had no salt in it nor garlic, cheese nor seasoning.  It was just boiled pasta tossed in tomatoe sauce/ paste.  The beetroot soup tasted bitter and had an orange flavour. I am sure the orange rind was also squeezed in when making the soup. 

Doesn't the chef taste the food before he sends it out? 🤮

I caught a bug and had diarrhoea and the others too complained about unsettled bowels.

reviews.title: Cleaner than expected
reviews.text: River is full of boats of many different varieties. Took a sailboat around the islands well worth it. Great place to people watch

reviews.title: Experience of a lifetime
reviews.text: Experience of a lifetime. From bustling Cairo to the peace of the Valley of the Kings, this extraordinary country will never be forgotten. Apart from the grandeur of the Nile River, tombs, temples and pyramids, the kindness and welcome from traders in the bazaars, shops, cafes, restaurants and guides will be always part of the story of Egypt.

reviews.title: Not as wide as we expected
reviews.text: We saw only one of Nile branches flowing on east side of Zamalek and this is why it did not seem very wide. Not much boat traffic on the river. We enjoyed 30 min ride in falucca boat.

reviews.title: Not a good experience
reviews.text: We were due to go on the holiday of a lifetime with Classic Holidays. The evening before we were due to go, all packed, house sitters in place, Classic Holidays phoned up to cancel. We had booked nine months before. We had 12 hours notice before we were due to leave home. Would I recommend them?  I don’t think so!

reviews.title: Rubbish to the river
reviews.text:
Please staff! Don't throw the RUBBISH BAGS for the Windows on the River!!!!

Thanks! It's for your country

reviews.title: Fascinating trip but tiring
reviews.text: River cruise on the Nile and visits to the temples on the way, relaxing apart from some early morning starts.

reviews.title: The Nile, Forever
reviews.text: The Nile has always thrilled me, providing a sense of unmatched living history. Enjoy the world's longest river by walking along shaded pathways, stopping by for a photo moment on the many bridges that span the river in Cairo, or take a cruise. We went on the Nile Maxim, a giant tourist boat with indifferent food, reasonable live band, spectacular belly dancer and a tannoura dancer who spent more time enabling photos than spinning! The boat was full that evening, so,we were overwhelmed by the noise and underwhelmed by the speed of service. But the Nile still enchanted

reviews.title: The Wheeler's Dream Vacation
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from the most memorable trip of our lives.  We went to Israel, Jordan, Egypt, South Africa, and Victoria Falls.  The trip was amazing,  The air flights were on schedule and very good airlines.  The hotels and other accomodations  were very nice, clean, and orderly.   The cruise on the Nile, the food, and other planned activities all went well and were so fun.  The drivers and guides that assisted us were courteous and knowledgeable.  I was happy with our whole experience and would recommend Travel Discounters to anyone who is looking for a fun and cost effective vacation.   Thanks for all those who helped plan, coordinate and make our vacation a success and an experience that we will always remember.  Thanks, The Wheelers

reviews.title: The pleasant breeze of the Nile with Egyptian culture
reviews.text: Great please enjoy Maghreb evening. Black tea, belly dance, Egyptian dinner and a pleasant blaze of Great Nile. Great experience.

reviews.title: AWFUL
reviews.text:
MS ROYAL VIKING should be avoided at all costs.
I've never felt so uncomfortable and trapped in my life.

DO NOT BOOK THIS CRUISE, the staff, boat condition and attitudes, absolutely wasted what should have been a magical experience.

We booked this accommodation independently, so we were not part of a group and should have been left in peace to sleep and eat onboard.

Youseff was very persistent on the first day that we needed to have an appointment, I repeatedly stated that we were not interested in buying tours. Then there was a chat about a schedule change, so we had to have a conversation.
I asked the reception for an updated schedule as we had to get back to Luxor in time to transfer for a flight, he told me he would print it in half an hour when he had no intention of doing so. Every basic question was answered with some kind of excuse.  

I had to unplug the phone in the room as they called to hassle us.  Thinking we were safe from their nonsense, they came to our room and banged on the door until we would open it.  Unbelievable!  All this to try to sell some tours, outrageous!!

Our room was comfortable. 
Needs some attention such as the double patio doors don't lock (very unsafe on the first floor when you are constantly parked beside other boats). 

The sink is a mess. 
The hair dryer needs time to cool down, so I had to leave half of my hair wet for 5 minutes until it would work again. 
The aircon stated it has a heat function, when we arrived it was particularly cool and we were told that the heating doesn't work, we should turn off the aircon and it'll get warmer.  
We spent 2 very dull late afternoons and evenings hiding under the extra duvet to keep warm while trying to watch the TV that is badly tuned or has awful reception, either way, unwatchable.  The smell from the bathroom while docked was very unpleasant!  I think it was plumbing odour mixed with diesel fumes.  
The stink of diesel, which got so much worse in Aswan, became the reason that we left so early on Friday morning 24th of December. The original booking was until the 27th but we would leave on the 26th to catch a flight.  I had difficulty breathing in the cabin and reception areas and that shouldn't happen!

The food was boring, with recommissioned variations of the same things.  We never had breakfast on the boat, only 1 breakfast pack as the other time we left so early we were told that it was too early to get a breakfast pack, which wasn't true.  I now know that's because we went on a private excursion and they don't really like that all.

The food needs attention. It's boring and bland. Neither eastern or western. I needed to cover everything in hot sauce.

The waiters were filling up bottles of water from used bottles and selling them on to guests. The drinks prices were totally over the top. They served us a beer with tiny plastic water cups at dinner. Came back half way through the meal for a signature. Frankly, it was sad and uncomfortable to be there. We tried to eat outside of the boat whenever possible.  

Youseff informed me a few times that I should pay £26GBP for tips and that it was stipulated in the booking. I've never heard of this before and did not pay it, tips for what? Harassment and bad service?  We left 3 days early because our holiday time is precious!  No apology, no offer of any kind of compensation, they made me write a letter stating that we were leaving of our own free will...seriously!  We all work hard all year to save to come on holiday and that was made even more difficult because of covid.  
No one seemed to care about that, they just wanted us to buy heavily inflated tours, drinks and sad photos that we reluctantly had taken.

We felt like the staff acted as if they were doing us a favour most of the time.
This is no five star cruise, 2 at best. It was a sad waste of our precious time and hard earned money.
It was my dream to visit Egypt and because of the hassle and constant pestering from Giza all the way down to Abu Simbal, my dream was ruined.  So, so sad!

reviews.title: Glad to see world  longest river
reviews.text: Nile river its name is enough for everyone I am also glad to see this river. The beauty of this river I can't describe in a word. I really love the view and enjoy the natural beauty.

reviews.title: if you are looking for a comfortable experience forget it, look for another boat
reviews.text:
forget to look for another floating hotel.
The noise of the engine and the vibration of the boat do not allow you to rest even if you are on the highest floor.
The pool and deck are comfortable but the service from the staff does not exist. The staff hardly understands English or even speaks it. The food is poor and transformed overnight in an unskilled and creative way.
Attention to sauces and the misery of desserts.
Luck is the opportunity to have different company at meal times..

reviews.title: Best Trip EVer
reviews.text: We took a Nile cruise guide were lucky enough to get as out tour guide Ahmed Haggag , and he was simply the best in every way imaginable. His knowledge was extensive from the small details to the largest. His personal touch was everywhere. We needed something from the pharmacy, he went out of his way to get what we needed. We always wanted to see Egypt and we have all seen the documentaries, but until they are fully explained with knowledge that you do not get except from someone who has lived it. it changes everything and makes it even more wonderful than you thought. This is what Ahmed did. I am from the US and am not a sponsor or anything like that,, Ahmed is just that good and I highly recommend him for your Egyptian Vacation. His whatsapp number is +20 100 099 1026. The cruise itself is good but the stops at all the shrine sites are fantastic . Once again Ahmed made our trip unforgettable.

reviews.title: Nile cruise with entertainment & buffet
reviews.text: Angie the tour guide was great & very informed about everything Egypt. The driver yousef was professional & polite. The cruise was simply perfect. The entertainment & the buffet were great.

reviews.title: MS Esadora Nile Cruise
reviews.text:
First time on a river cruise ship, best way to see The Nile Valley, the sunsets and views were stunning.  We had 12 excursions included and some optionals,  its a good way to visit historic sites and get in some relaxing time too.  We did 7 days.
Food was all inclusive but at set times.  Felt it was 'tourist food' however there was a good selection of salads, rice, pasta, breads and meat dishes.  Breakfast was my favourite meal. Not all drinks are in the inclusive package, but we felt it was still good value as only another £25 upgrade from the soft drinks package.
Boat is looking alittle tired but well maintained and very clean.  There are more fancy boats around, not sure if a price difference.  We had a suite, nice size and always good water pressure and hot water in the bathroom.
The staff were very attentive and always happy to help.  I had a massage, it was brutal, but very good.  I also felt the oils/creams helped with the sun and dry heat.

We had an excellent Guide Michael and kept us on schedule.  Be prepared for early starts.  Photos don't do Ancient Egypt justice, it must be experienced.

Pro's - Once on aboard, able to relax and enjoy sites, meeting other guests
Con's - boats can dock next to each other, therefore at times, not able to look outside window.
Sellers are everywhere off the boat, be prepared for repeating a polite No and keep moving lol.

Tipping off the boat, Toilets 5 Egyptian pounds 

Would we do it again ? Yes we would, go with an open mind, its a fantastic adventure, we loved it.

reviews.title: The Great River Nile with it's dirty future
reviews.text:
We were reached to the river by the tour bus. At the first glance, it seems that it is ordinary river from your country but in essence it contain the immense history. 
   What can we say, the Nile river is very dirty. The garbage in and out of the river. Briefly, the garbage surrounds this river. When you ask question about this trashes to your guide, he just calmly answer that the problem with garbage truck that municipality did not solve yet. Another moment that I noticed, that there great deal of pigeons that fly and rest near river. 
   According to words of tour guide there are also inhabit the crocodiles in this river.

name: Cairo Citadel
ranking_subcategory: #20 of 288 things to do in Cairo
subcategory_ranking: #20 of 288 things to do in Cairo
ranking: #20 of 288 things to do in Cairo
description: This massive stone fortress, built by Salah ad-Din in the 12th century, was crowned with the Mosque of Mohammed Ali 700 years later.

offer_list.title: Cairo Private Day Tour to Egyptian Museum Citadel and Khan Khalili Bazaar
Full Day Tour Visiting Coptic and Islamic Cairo
Day Trip to Giza Pyramids Old Cairo Citadel and Bazaar
Best Two-Day Private Guided City Tour of Cairo Giza and Saqqara
Private Day Tour: to Citadel - Coptic & Islamic Cairo

reviews.title: Salah El Din Citadel
reviews.text: Known as Salah El Din citadel. Must visit place in Cairo egypt. Entrance fee is 200EGP per person and 70EGP for car. You can hire golf car by paying 10-20EGP to go up instead of walking. Muhammad Ali masjid and Nasser Khawayan masjid located in same place. You can see pyramid from citadel if weather is fine. You need to cover your shoe while entering the masjid and need to tip 5EGP per person. Masjid is in original condition.

reviews.title: worth it on a lovely day
reviews.text: it was a lovely day weather wise. The walk up to the Citadel was great. The mosques are lovely. The school kids, also touring, were friendly and curious about foreigners. The view across Cairo from the top was really amazing.

reviews.title: Beautiful Mosque and view of the city
reviews.text:
This is worth a visit if you have extra time in Cairo. IF the smog isn't too bad, you can get great views of the city. Th fortress ramparts are impressive. AS other reviewers have said, the Mohammed-Ali Mosque is very beautiful and is an imposing figure on the skyline. Appreciate the elaborate interior and dome décor.

The Suleiman Pasha Mosque is presently closed under renovation.

Tip: You don't have to purchase disposable shoe covers (5 LG per pair at the door), but can just take off your shoes and carry them into the Mosque.

reviews.title: Spectacular view of Cairo
reviews.text: The mosque of Mohammed Ali at the Citadel is worth the visit and the view of Cairo from there is spectacular— especially of the Madrassa and Mosque of Sultan Hassan. There is a lovely older mosque across the alley. Other than that, there is nothing much to see. Allow for an hour or so at the Citadel.

reviews.title: Thanks, Salah-al-Din
reviews.text: This is an impressive building.  Like many Egyptian tourist sites, the signage is very poor, and you just wait for someone to yell at you that you're going the wrong way.  The citadel includes two mosques, including the fabulous Muhammad Ali mosque.  There's a military museum there as well.

reviews.title: Fabulous views from the Citadel
reviews.text:
Worth a visit for an hour. Nothing much to see outside except for the great views of Cairo. However, the interior of the Citadel is very beautiful and nicely decorated. 

The 200 LE entrance fee is a bit pricey and the best options to reach the Citadel will be by Uber or follow a day tour.

Beware: There are a lot of teenagers roaming around the Citadel requesting to take pictures with you. Don't fall for the trap as they are just asking for tips.

reviews.title: A Good way to spend 1 hr
reviews.text:
The citadel is in disrepair and not much to see.
A good view of Cairo from up there but nothing to see in the old fortress 
The alabaster Mosque is worth the effort since it’s in the he same area

reviews.title: Fab views and gorgeous mosque
reviews.text: The views were amazing of Cairo and we saw the Pyramids from up there - go on a clear day when not so hazy. The mosque is beautiful. So glad we visited, relaxing up here and nice to be out of the hustle and bustle.

reviews.title: Worth a visit for less than an hour
reviews.text: Worth a visit to see something most day tourist don't get to.  Great view of Cairo from the top. I don't think the entire complex takes more than an hour to see.

reviews.title: Serene mutual faceted site with so much more to offer than pyramids and antiquities museum.
reviews.text:
It houses 2 immensely stunning Mosques, museums containing better exhibits than the Egyptian antiquities museum, stunningly clean and less crowded cafe and atmosphere. No 1 thing to do in Cairo better than pyramids and antiquities museum in our experience.

So peaceful, clean and well taken care of. Just stunning we saw so many tourists sit and be at peace in the Mosque like us (non Muslims).

You just feel so serene in the whole experience which has so many things to see in one safe contained space. Family friendly too.

reviews.title: Spectacular place
reviews.text:
It is a place you can feel , hear and see history in every place. 

The mosque was too much peaceful and quiet even you wish to stay there the whole life. 

Wether now in Egypt is a spectacular warm and cold at the same time. 

The museums some what old and need attention more but still bringing children attention. 

You should go there.

reviews.title: Fort
reviews.text: Old army Ford we were told originating around the 1100s never actually used in a battle. Worth walking around several museums to go into, water closets and a couple of Mosque. Good views from the top you can even see the pyramids

reviews.title: Beautiful architecture.
reviews.text: Also known as the Alabastar mosque. Once a beautiful site. The architecture in the mosque is beautiful. Views from the top are amazing.

reviews.title: Huge but not well maintained
reviews.text: It is a large fortification, but little care is taken to make it tourist friendly. I thought it would be like Alhambra that we visited in April, but it was not. It does not have much of a wow factor. Were it not for military museum that we found very interesting it would not be worth visiting.

reviews.title: Well worth a visit!
reviews.text: We went to the Citadel by Uber and did a self guided tour. Entry is 200 EGP and this provides access to the Citadel, Mohammed Ali Mosque, National Police Museum and National Military Museum; all of which are worth a visit. We found it a great way to spend the afternoon and see some sites that weren’t ancient Egypt.

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: We visited the Citadel and mosque in August 2022.  Amazing view from the top.  Very interesting history.  Hot though.

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.text: An interesting tour of a historical site.  A great view overlooking Cairo.  Ground around the site is uneven so need to take care walking.

reviews.title: Definitely something interesting and different
reviews.text:
Another interesting part of Egypt and its history I definitely enjoyed seeing this citadel and also the mosque of Mohammed Ali is here so you basically pay once to see two attractions which is good. It was 200 EGP. I liked learning about it from my tour guide but you can also go it alone should you wish. 
It has a great view of Cairo and because it’s built high up as it was meant to be a position a military leader could defend from so the view is awesome and it has these amazing walls which looks like a castle. Something different but also enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Has never worked
reviews.text: On the west wall of the courtyard is a huge iron clock that was given as a gift in the 1840s to the Turkish ruler of Egypt, Muhammad Ali, by the French King, Louis Philippe. The clock was given in exchange for the ancient Egyptian obelisk that now stands at Place de la Concorde in Paris. The clock has rarely worked and probably never will, but in 2021 the Council of Antiquities announced that it was going to be repaired. It is one of the oldest of its type in the world. Photos are allowed. (PaM)

reviews.title: Citadel of Cairo, good views and beautiful old buildings
reviews.text: Beautiful old buildings situated on top of a Hill with good view of Cairo city. Police museum and 2 mosques are amongst the things you can see. Entry is 200 egyptian pounds.

reviews.title: A "huge site" & "many sites" within :)
reviews.text:
Really a "big sprawling" site with the Muhammad Ali Mosque as its "main feature" but which is not the only one to visit at this site, I made a total of "four stops" each at a smaller site within this big site (but all four just pretty close to one another): the first stop at the "smaller mosque" which is just quite a plain one with its own "interior square" to walk around along the corridors on four sides (with just some specific item of a sundial or such where I was taken to by the caretaker gentleman); the second stop at the "main mosque" Muhammad Ali with some round-shaped pavilion-like structure in the middle of its "interior square" and where on one side of the square is a small-but-glittering clock tower and where on another side of the square by "looking up above" is really a great view of the "grand architecture" of the Mosque seen almost in its entirety with the main dome & the two tall minarets (with the only parts not seen from that square being the two smaller domes on the opposite side of the Mosque); the third stop at the viewpoint (actually located right on the back side of Muhammad Ali after going through its square) for a "nice panorama" of the city although the skyline with modern buildings is not nearby but kind of a distant view; and finally the fourth stop at the National Military Museum which is a "pretty sizeable" outdoor area with plenty of miscellaneous military hardware items on display (such as old cannons, modern artillery guns, tanks, armored vehicles some of which with rockets mounted on them & actually also 2 or 3 small planes) and where apart from those various armaments are also a number of stone busts of some great "warrior pharaohs" from the times past & also standing statues (somewhat larger than life-sized) of Egypt's "first two presidents".

After about a half-day of about 3.5 hours, I headed from here to the Mosque of Ibn Tulun at just a short 10-to-15-minute taxi ride away (not a great architectural-styled mosque as the Muhammad Ali Mosque at this site, but actually one with an "interior square" larger than that at Muhammad Ali and above all with a minaret "for going up" where from the top are nice views all around including that of this great citadel).

reviews.title: Cairo Must See- But timing can add or diminish the experience!
reviews.text:
The Cairo Citadel towers over the city and is an absolute Must Visit. Yes, as with most Egypt sights, this is a very different experience for those with Mobility Issues or on large tours. The way to see all the sights in Egypt is with a small group and planning around known busy periods, But This is Not Always Possible.

We planned the visit for early (The light behind us looking towards the Nile and the Pyramids AND small crowds) and we enjoy walking and a little outside time. It was an exceptionally clear day, but this is also because of the lower pollution on Fridays. We spent around an hour wandering around the grounds and some more time in the Mosque.

reviews.title: Pfff
reviews.text:
